properties.name: Dwellingup Fast Water Rafting Tour
properties.description:
Experience the thrills of the Murray River on a self-guided Fast Water Rafting tour. No need to worry about any logistics as Dwellingup Adventures do all the organizing for you! Meet at the Tours Desk, located at the award-winning Dwellingup Trails and Visitors Centre with the lovely Waypoints Cafe. 

From here you will get fitted out with your safety equipment and head to the start of the rafting experience, following a guide in your own vehicle. Leave your vehicle at the finish point and let Dwellingup Adventures transport you to the start, stopping along the way to point out river features. 

You spend the next few hours shooting some small rapids, paddling through fast-moving channels and along wide pools at your own pace. The lightness of your inflated raft allows you to easily carry your raft back above some of the rapids where you can shoot them multiple times before paddling to the finish point at Dwaarlindjirraap, where you rendezvous with Dwellingup Adventures and your car.

- Operates daily.
- Starts: 10.30am. Finishes: 3.00pm
- Self-guided
- Ages 6+ recommended

properties.name: Naturaliste Charters Bremer Canyon Whale and Orca Tours
properties.description:
Naturaliste Charters are the longest running whale watching company in the Southwest and have been operating professional whale watching tours out of Augusta and Dunsborough for more than 30 years, Established in 1993.
Naturaliste Charters also developed Bremer Canyon Killer Whale Expeditions in 2015, we are the only operator with knowledge and experience in this remote offshore environment. 

We are unrivalled in finding wildlife and keeping you safe , while educating you along the way.
Creating world class experiences isn't just our job, it is everything that we are and we want to share it with you. 100% Whale Guarantee - See whales or join us again for FREE.

Our 20 metre catamaran vessel the beautiful ‘Alison Maree’ is purpose-built for the Southern Ocean, providing excellent stability and comfort for our passengers. Great viewing from the cabin and fantastic viewing areas from the fly bridge, bow and stern.Spend time spotting wildlife on the bow, the huge upper and lower rear decks, or try all three. Inside join the skipper on the flybridge for the ultimate 360 degree birds-eye view or relax in the air-conditioned, spacious and comfortable main saloon.

Interpretive, educational tour with expert commentary, Marine Biologist onboard.

Morning or Afternoon tea provided.

properties.name: Pinnacles Stargazing
properties.description:
Explore Western Australia's Pinnacle Desert on a guided full day from Perth to the Australian Outback to sample delicious food, wine and chocolate before watching the sunset go down over the desert and enjoy a unique dinner under the stars!

Highlights: 

- A unique tour to the Pinnacles Desert
- Sample wine, chocolate and honey
- Enjoy the thrill of sand boarding in Lancelin
- Dinner under the stars in the pinnacles desert
- View the stars & planets through a telescope
- Learn about Aboriginal astronomy & Dreamtime

properties.name: Swim with the Whale Sharks
properties.description:
Swim with Whale Sharks on a luxurious 55ft sailing catamaran WINDCHEETAH exploring the Ningaloo Reef - The only place in Australia where you can swim with whale sharks! 

This day cruise includes close encounters with a number of marine life including dugongs, sea turtles, dolphins, tropical fish and even manta rays.

**Highlights**  

-   In water experience with Whale Sharks
-   Operates March, April, May, June and July
-   Snorkelling on the Ningaloo Reef
-   Morning Tea, Buffet Lunch & Afternoon Tea
-   Quality snorkel equipment included
-   Professional and experienced crew on board

properties.name: Esperance Island Cruises
properties.description:
Embark on an Esperance Island Cruise and immerse yourself in the coastal wonders of this region. Traverse azure waters, discovering secluded islands, pristine beaches, and vibrant marine life. 

Witness breathtaking scenery and perhaps catch glimpses of dolphins or seals, making for a memorable and picturesque nautical adventure.

properties.name: Perth Wildlife Encounters
properties.description:
WELCOME TO WILD LUXURY

Blessed with white sandy beaches and surrounded by crystal clear waters, Penguin Island is just 50 minutes south of Perth and lies a five minute ferry ride away in the heart of the ruggedly spectacular Shoalwater Islands Marine Park. Join us for a cruise to see wild dolphins and rare Australian sea lions before visiting beautiful Penguin island. 

Getting here is easy with ferries departing hourly from 9am to 3pm. Spend as long, or as little as you like on Penguin Island returns don not need to be booked in advanced! You can swim, snorkel, picnic and explore the nature trails and beaches before catching a return ferry at your leisure. 

It is our privilege to share this beautiful part of the coast & its wildlife and we hope you enjoy your visit.

All our Dolphin, Penguin & Sea Lion Cruises depart from Penguin Island. Please allow enough time for your 5 minute ferry transfer to Penguin Island (9:00am, 10:00am, 11:00am, 12:00pm, 1:00pm, 2:00pm or 3:00pm) prior to cruise departure. Ferry transfers are included.

properties.name: Frenchman Peak Summit Walk
properties.description:
The Frenchman Peak Summit Walk is a 3-kilometre return hike that takes you to the summit of Frenchman Peak, the tallest peak in the park. The trail is rated as Grade 5, hard, and it is steep and challenging in some sections. 

The hike starts at the Frenchman Bay campground and winds its way through a forest of karri trees. The trail then climbs steeply up the side of the mountain, offering stunning views of the surrounding coastline and islands.

properties.name: The Valley of the Giants Tree Top Walk
properties.description:
The Valley of the Giants Tree Top Walk is a must-see attraction for anyone visiting Western Australia. The Tree Top Walk is a 600-metre-long elevated walkway that takes you through the heart of the Walpole Wilderness, where you can see some of the tallest and oldest trees in the world.

The Tree Top Walk is suitable for all ages and fitness levels, and it's a great way to experience the beauty of the Walpole Wilderness from a unique perspective. As you walk through the canopy of the trees, you'll be able to see the forest floor far below and the treetops all around you. You'll also be able to spot a variety of wildlife, including birds, lizards, and even koalas.

The best time to visit is during the spring (September to November) or autumn (March to May) months. The weather is mild during these times of year, and there are fewer crowds.

properties.name: Rottnest Island Day Tour
properties.description:
This Rottnest Island discovery tour will take you on a journey stopping off at some spectacular locations, including the Wadjemup Lighthouse and the rugged West End. The 90-minute tour of the Island takes you to some of the most scenic locations in the region and provides you with a complete interpretation of the Island through the commentary from the passionate and knowledgable crew.

Highlights:
- Explore the beauty and tranquility of Rottnest
- Experience this unique A-class nature reserve
- Commentary from knowledgable crew
- Diverse wildlife and fauna
- Includes ferry and Perth CBD hotel pickup
- Beaches, bays, walking trails & more

properties.name: Lucky Bay
properties.description:
Australia's whitest beach, Lucky Bay, is regularly mentioned in the conversation for Australia's best beach, being one of Western Australia's most idyllic; the biggest jewel in a string of stunning beaches along the coast of Cape Le Grand National Park and Esperance. 

Its squeaky-clean sand, turquoise water, perfect swimming conditions and breathtaking views of the Recherche Archipela and with all kinds of wildlife able to be spotted here, from turtles to kangaroos!

properties.name: Lancelin Sand Dunes
properties.description:
The Lancelin Sand Dunes are a striking natural feature located in Lancelin, Western Australia. These vast sand dunes stretch for approximately two kilometres along the coastline and are a popular destination for outdoor enthusiasts and adventure seekers. 

Key features and activities at the Lancelin Sand Dunes include: 

Sandboarding and Sand Sledding: The dunes provide an excellent opportunity for sandboarding or sand sledding. Visitors can hire sandboards or sleds locally and slide down the steep slopes, offering a thrilling experience akin to snowboarding or sledding. 

Photography: The dunes' dramatic and ever-shifting sandscape makes for a picturesque setting and an ideal location for photography and capturing stunning desert landscapes. 

Four-Wheel Driving: Adventurous travelers with four-wheel-drive vehicles often enjoy exploring the sandy terrain and the dunes' off-road trails. 

Sunset Viewing: The Lancelin Sand Dunes offer a particularly breathtaking backdrop for viewing sunsets. Many visitors come to witness the sun dipping below the horizon, casting warm hues across the dunes. 

Camel Riding: Some tour operators in the area offer camel rides through the sand dunes, providing a unique perspective of this natural wonder. 

The Lancelin Sand Dunes are a fun and picturesque destination, and they offer a unique experience of desert-like landscapes against the backdrop of the Western Australian coastline. Visitors are encouraged to respect the environment and follow local guidelines to ensure the dunes remain a pristine natural attraction.

properties.name: Hamersley Gorge
properties.description:
This is a dramatic gorge, full of colour, texture and reflections and a great spot for a swim.

Located in Karijini National Park in Western Australia, it is one of the most popular tourist destinations in the park, and is known for its spectacular scenery, abundant wildlife and amazing swimming holes. 

The gorge is about 4 kilometres long and up to 100 metres deep. It is formed by the Hamersley River, which has cut through the ancient rocks of the Hamersley Range over millions of years.

properties.name: Hamelin Bay
properties.description: Hamelin Bay on the southwest coast is a serene open sandy bay, famous for the abundance of stingrays which frequent the bay. Snorkel around the bay to enjoy a personal interaction with these remarkable sting rays and see them close up in their natural habitat.

properties.name: Kangaroo Haven Wildlife Rescue
properties.description:
Kangaroo Haven Wildlife Rescue are a family owned sanctuary for Australian wildlife.

A dedicated sanctuary located in Kununurra, Western Australia, it provides care and rehabilitation for injured, orphaned, and displaced wildlife, with a special focus on kangaroos. Visitors to Kangaroo Haven can experience first hand the incredible work done to rescue and nurture native animals, while learning about their rehabilitation journey and the challenges they face in the wild.

The sanctuary offers guided tours where you can meet rescued kangaroos, wallabies, and other native species. It's a heart warming experience that highlights the importance of wildlife conservation. Kangaroo Haven operates through donations and community support, so every visit helps contribute to the wellbeing of Australia's unique animals. 

A visit here is perfect for nature lovers, families, and anyone looking to support local wildlife efforts during their trip to the Kimberley region.

properties.name: Serpentine Falls Walking Trail
properties.description:
The Serpentine Falls Walk Trail, located in the beautiful and diverse Peel Region of WA, is an easy stroll from the car park to see the lovely Falls, or you can venture on top to see the cascade from the viewing platform.

The star attraction of Serpentine National Park, the falls create an awesome swimming hole to cool off in after your walk.

properties.name: RAC Monkey Mia Dolphin Resort
properties.description: RAC Monkey Mia Dolphin Resort is situated within the Shark Bay World Heritage Area in WA's North West. Meet the friendly resident dolphins, discover breathtaking snorkelling spots, or just take a moment to relax and enjoy our absolute beachfront location. Choose from a range of powered, unpowered, or ensuite sites, with pet-friendly and beach view options available. Our campgrounds feature a range of amenities and facilities to make your stay more comfortable, including modern camp kitchens, guest laundries, ablution blocks, dump points, BBQ facilities, and more. If it's entertainment you're looking for, you'll find 2 swimming pools, mini golf, a restaurant and bar, recreation room and plenty of kids activities on site.

properties.name: RAC Exmouth Cape Holiday Park
properties.description: The North West coastal town of Exmouth is a bucket list destination, alive with spectacular scenery and extraordinary encounters. RAC Exmouth Cape Holiday Park puts you within 1km of Exmouth town centre, and just moments from everything this exciting region has to offer. Choose from a range of powered or unpowered, pet-friendly, and ensuite sites. Our park offers a range of amenities and facilities for your convenience, including a modern camp kitchen, recreation room and swimming pool, laundry, shared ablution blocks, vehicle wash down bay and dump points.

properties.name: Western Australia Visitor Centre
properties.description:
# The Western Australia Visitor Centre
The Western Australia Visitor Centre welcomes travellers to come in, explore, enquire and discover more about the must-see places on offer in Perth and throughout Western Australia.  
  
Relax in one of their lounges and chill-out areas while you decide where your travels will take you. The printed guides, maps and touchscreens provide you with a wealth of information to prepare you for your journey throughout Western Australia.  
  
Browse the gifts and souvenirs that showcases locally-made Western Australian and Australian quality products available for purchase.  
  
Want to know more? Their friendly staff can answer all your questions and arrange bookings for your travel needs and experiences.

## Book your dream Western Australian holiday here!
##### [Tours, Attractions and Accommodation](https://book.bookeasy.com/agent/western-australia-visitor-centre/6248585/)


## Things to do
##### [Tours and Attractions](https://www.wavisitorcentre.com.au/things-to-do/tours-attractions)


## Accommodation
##### [All Accommodation](https://www.wavisitorcentre.com.au/accommodation/all-accommodation)


## Explore
##### [Our Must See Locations](https://www.wavisitorcentre.com.au/explore/our-must-visit-locations)
##### [Perth and Surrounds](https://www.wavisitorcentre.com.au/explore/perth-surrounds)
##### [The Kimberley](https://www.wavisitorcentre.com.au/explore/the-kimberley)
##### [Coral Coast](https://www.wavisitorcentre.com.au/explore/coral-coast)
##### [South West](https://www.wavisitorcentre.com.au/explore/south-west)
##### [Golden Outback](https://www.wavisitorcentre.com.au/explore/golden-outback)

properties.name: Tasman Holiday Parks - Denham Seaside
properties.description:
Denham Seaside Caravan Park is famous for its absolute water frontage and panoramic ocean views with gorgeous sunsets in the Shark Bay World Heritage Area.

Located right on the beautiful Shark Bay with its own lovely safe pet friendly beach and just a short walk away from the town's hotels, restaurants, jetties, waterfront playground, bakery and coffee shops.

With a range of options including family accommodation with sweeping sunset ocean views, powered caravan and camping sites, powered ensuite sites and unpowered camping sites, there is a suitable option for everyone and every budget.

properties.name: Tasman Holiday Parks - Serpentine Falls
properties.description:
Stay and play in our stunning natural playground, only 50 minutes from Perth and a world away from cares.

In the heart of the captivating Darling Ranges, Tasman Holiday Parks: Serpentine Falls offers a warm welcome, flexible accommodation and a wealth of attractions for travellers in search of escape.

With the famous Serpentine Falls, renowned Millbrook Winery and historic Jarrahdale at arm’s reach, you can kick back and explore at your own pace.

Whether you want a site for your caravan or a spacious luxe cabin, our versatile accommodation delivers.

Perfect for short breaks or longer stays, we’re hanging out to meet you!

properties.name: RAC Margaret River Nature Park
properties.description: RAC Margaret River Nature Park is nestled amidst the towering timber of the Wooditjup National Park (formerly Bramley), providing a peaceful eco-experience for all. Choose from powered or unpowered sites, and enjoy access to our campground facilities including a camp kitchen, guest laundry, modern ablution blocks, nature playground, and more. Our park is conveniently located just a short stroll from the town centre.

properties.name: Tasman Holiday Parks - Kalbarri
properties.description:
Tasman Holiday Park Kalbarri has a wide range of accommodation options including three options for campervans, tents and Caravans. Our coastal Oasis is in a central location, just a short walk from shops, restaurants and the Murchison River.

Select from spacious grassy sites with or without power to suit your needs, perhaps Pet friendly option or the ever popular Beachview sites. Holiday Park facilities include Ensuite Bathrooms, we have blocks of ensuite bathrooms rather than traditional open amenities. Each clean and roomy ensuite has a toilet, shower, sink, mirror, towel rail and bench. Suitable for single travellers, couples or families. Limited mobility options to recommend booking well in advance

Other shared facilities include  kitchen, equipped with cook tops, a barbecue, microwave, toaster, fridge/freezer, kettle and sink

Escape the daily grind and create unforgettable memories at our friendly holiday park. Our dedicated staff is here to make your stay comfortable and enjoyable. After an active day, relax and unwind with a breathtaking sunset over the water.

properties.name: RAC Cervantes Holiday Park
properties.description: Just two hours from Perth, RAC Cervantes Holiday Park offers the ultimate family holiday getaway. Walk to the nearby beach, with a huge range of coastal activities waiting for you to explore. The famous Pinnacles are within a short drive, while walking trails and other outdoor pursuits will fill your days with adventure. Choose from a range of powered and unpowered sites, with grass and firm ground options available. Enjoy the convenience of our modern campground facilities, including a camp kitchen, shared amenities, guest laundry, recreation room, swimming pool, and more.

properties.name: Tasman Holiday Parks - Yallingup Beach
properties.description:
Perfectly situated for exploring the south-western coast of Australia, Tasman Holiday Parks - Yallingup Beach is a world apart.

Whether it’s a family weekend or a longer stop for grey nomads, this is a place to unwind

Sit back and watch the western sun set on the Indian Ocean. Relax and be lulled to sleep by the sounds of the ocean.

Our Yallingup Beach holiday park is designed to make the most of this beautiful location. You’ll discover grassy green pockets nestled among ancient banksia trees, perfect for parking the van or setting up a tent.

In the morning the adventure begins anew. Cross the road for crisp white sands and the azure ocean. Catch a wave, catch a fish or just chill by the lagoon.

Dogs welcome from May to 30 November.

properties.name: RAC Cable Beach Holiday Park
properties.description:
RAC Cable Beach Holiday Park is located in Broome, right in the heart of WA's breathtaking North West. When you're looking for Broome accommodation, we've got just the spot for you.

With the famous Cable Beach within a short walk, shady powered and pet-friendly sites available, campground facilities including a camp kitchen, shared amenities block, laundry, BBQ facilities and more, you can kick back in comfort amongst the lush tropical gardens or lay by the swimming pool before heading out to explore everything Broome has to offer.

properties.name: Gracetown Caravan Park
properties.description:
A family friendly Park set on 13 acres of a bushy setting. Gracetown Caravan Park is a short drive to the beach (3 mins) and a 10 minute drive to the Main street of Margaret River. 

The Caravan Park is home to wildlife including kangaroos, possums and kookaburras so no dogs or Cats are allowed. We are located right in the middle of the Gorgeous Margaret River Wine Region with Wineries, breweries, chocolate, cheese, olive oil all within a few minutes drive of our property!

properties.name: RAC Esperance Holiday Park
properties.description: Located directly across from Esperance Bay, RAC Esperance Holiday Park allows you to experience the beauty of WA's Great Southern Edge. Walk to Esperance town centre, or head further out to discover the white sands and clear waters of West Beach, Blue Haven Beach, and Twilight Bay. You'll also find the renowned Cape Le Grand National Park within an easy drive, with its sweeping views, hidden beaches, and scenic hiking trails. Choose from a range of powered grass or slab sites, or upgrade to an ensuite site. Our pet-friendly park features modern camp kitchen facilities, a spacious recreation room and heated swimming pool, plenty of BBQs, and ablution blocks. Plus, enjoy the convenience of our laundry, dump points, vehicle wash bay, and general store.

properties.name: Ocean Park Aquarium and Shark Feeding Tour
properties.description:
Explore the wonders of the Shark Bay Marine Park with a marine scientist by your side on a fun, highly educational tour that will leave you breathless.

Watch the raw fury of sharks feeding; discover endangered sea turtles, highly venomous sea snakes, excruciating stonefish and more! Learn about the secret lives of clownfish, stingrays, and visit our rescued sea turtles with your entertaining tour guide who can cater for the whole family. 

Ocean Park Aquarium is a captivating marine life sanctuary located in Ocean Park, a picturesque coastal destination. This educational and immersive facility is a haven for marine enthusiasts of all ages. Visitors can explore a diverse range of aquatic ecosystems, from coral reefs to deep-sea environments, showcasing a plethora of stunning marine species.

properties.name: RAC Karri Valley Resort
properties.description:
Lose yourself in the majestic Karri Forest at RAC Karri Valley Resort. Surrounded by the Greater Beedelup National Park, you can enjoy a short stroll to the Beedelup Falls or adventure via kayak through Lake Beedelup. Our campgrounds offer powered and unpowered sites with a mixture of grass or slab ground, or upgrade your stay to an ensuite site. Enjoy the comforts of our modern campground facilities, including state-of-the-art camp kitchen, shared ablution blocks, a large recreation room, BBQ facilities, tennis court, playgrounds, and more. If you stay in our caravan park, you are invited to make the most of our resort activities, which are all within a 20-minute walk or short bike ride. These include walking trails, canoe and SUP hire, mini-golf, archery, bike rental and our animal farm.
Our caravan park is located on the edge of the Beedelup national park and therefore we are not able to accept pets.

properties.name: Willie Creek Pearl Farm Tour
properties.description:
A visit to the Willie Creek Pearl Farm is a must do WA attraction to include when you visit Broome. Just 1 hour's drive from Broome through the striking Kimberley region, the famous award winning facility is open to the public and is a fantastic trip from Broome. 

On arrival, be guided through the process of modern cultured pearl farming on an interactive tour of the farm. Learn how pearl technicians seed and harvest oysters and discover exactly what makes the perfect pearl. The tour includes a mesmerising cruise through the crystal blue waters of Willie Creek where you will see live oysters in their natural environment.

You'll also experience a live pearl harvest and learn about the process and care taken to choose the best pearls to transform into beautiful pieces of jewellery. There is ample time to browse in the showroom after the tour. The Willie Creek Pearl Farm Tour last 5 hours including travel time, and includes a morning or afternoon tea. We recommend a 4WD on the self drive tour as the road is partially unsealed and the condition of the road may vary.

properties.name: Tasman Holiday Parks - Yallingup Caves
properties.description:
Perfect for a family getaway or a group of friends, our two bedroom self-contained chalets let you experience the fun of camping without the hassle of setting up a tent! 

Our chalets are located in amongst the action, allowing you to soak up the atmosphere of a caravan park but have all the modern luxuries at hand. We’re proud to say that we are a smoke-free park, with no smoking in the park or accommodation.

properties.name: Mandalay Holiday Resort
properties.description: Mandalay Holiday Resort & Tourist Park, situated between Busselton and Dunsborough in Western Australia, is your perfect destination. It is a unique beach resort with high quality, self-contained accommodation. If you are after a Busselton Caravan Park, Busselton Camping or chalet or cabin accommodation, look no further. We have two-bedroom and three-bedroom accommodation. As well as powered caravan and camping sites with 5-star resort facilities. Perfect for everyone, whether you just want to relax at the resort or use it as a base for your adventures. We look forward to welcoming you!

properties.name: RAC Busselton Holiday Park
properties.description: Nestled on the doorsteps of Busselton and Dunsborough, RAC Busselton Holiday Park is the perfect setting for your next escape. Set amongst eight hectares of natural bushland, you can relax by the Peppermint Trees or stroll down to the crystal-clear waters of nearby Geographe Bay. We offer a range of powered and unpowered, ensuite, and pet-friendly sites. You can enjoy access to our camp kitchen, swimming pools, laundry, shared amenities blocks, games room and more.

properties.name: Kalbarri River Gorges and Coastal Cliffs Flight
properties.description:
Taking off from Kalbarri, passengers will be treated to a 45 minute scenic flight over Murchison River and rugged coastal cliffs. See more from the air as you soar over the Western Australia coastline’s best beaches and iconic rocky gorges such as Little Z Bend, Big Z Bend and Four Ways.

Flyover Ross Graham Lookout of Kalbarri National Park surrounding the lower reaches of Murchison River where a magnificent 80 kilometre gorge unfolds before your eyes with vibrant red and white banded sandstone formations. Return to Kalbarri Airport via the Murchison House Station, the coastal cliffs with their amazing red sedimentary rock colours and a brief Kalbarri overfly.

properties.name: Sunset Camel Ride on Cable Beach
properties.description:
The sunset camel ride is a relaxing and informative experience along the beautiful white sands of Cable Beach. Watch the awe-inspiring backdrop of the sun setting over the Indian Ocean, from atop your camel. 

BOOK EARLY! As our iconic sunset tours is often booked out days ahead. Red Sun Camels is a unique and captivating desert adventure company, specialising in guided camel tours in the heart of Australia's iconic Red Centre. Nestled in the breathtaking landscapes of Uluru and Kata Tjuta, Red Sun Camels offers an unforgettable experience for travellers seeking a deeper connection with nature and indigenous culture.

Their fleet of friendly and well-cared-for camels, guided by knowledgeable and passionate handlers, take you on a mesmerizing journey through the red sand dunes, offering panoramic views of the stunning desert scenery. As the sun sets over the horizon, the remarkable colours and tranquility of the Outback come alive, creating an otherworldly atmosphere.

Red Sun Camels not only provides a memorable adventure but also fosters an appreciation for the rich Aboriginal heritage and the incredible environment of this remote region. It's an extraordinary way to embrace the Red Centre's soul and experience its magic in a sustainable and respectful manner.

properties.name: Lake Argyle Scenic Cruise
properties.description:
As the old saying goes, "red sky at night, sailors' delight" and there's no better way to experience a breathtaking Lake Argyle sunset than out on the water! On the popular sunset magic cruise, you'll explore the rugged northern end of Lake Argyle while navigating through some of the lake's 90 islands and inlets. The Skipper will entertain and inform with commentary on the natural history and development of Lake Argyle, The Ord River Irrigation System and the Aquaculture Industry. You'll encounter Rock Wallabies, Crocodiles, Wallaroos (Euros) and the diverse array of birdlife that call Lake Argyle home. 

You'll be delighted and awed by the Archer Fish that shoot water up at your hand with amazing precision. You'll watch a Catfish feeding frenzy (also known by the fancier term of Silver Cobbler') and perhaps you'll even be enticed to come back out on one of our fishing trips. As the sun sinks behind the glorious Carr Boyd Ranges, you'll enjoy a complimentary drink and a light snack to make the most of this magic time of day. With rugged red cliffs reflecting into the blue water, Lake Argyle is the ultimate place to catch the last golden rays of the Kimberley sun. Includes: Complimentary afternoon tea and alcoholic and non alcoholic beverages. Average Duration: 3.5 hours Note: We specialise in observing wildlife, but due to the nature of wild animals it cannot be guaranteed you will see all that is described in our services. Dress Code and what to bring: Dress 'Kimberley casual' - shorts, t-shirt and sandals. Don't forget your hat, sunscreen, camera, towel and swimwear. If you are sensitive to the cold, bring a light jacket to wear while we are motoring. Warm clothing may be required from June to August.

Lake Argyle Cruises offers a breathtaking adventure in the heart of Western Australia's Kimberley region. Nestled against the Ord River, Lake Argyle is Australia's largest man-made reservoir, surrounded by stunning landscapes and abundant wildlife. Lake Argyle Cruises provides an unforgettable way to explore this unique environment.

properties.name: Malcolm Douglas Crocodile Park
properties.description:
Join this half-day Broome tour to Malcolm Douglas Crocodile Park for your chance to experience the famous daily crocodile feeding tour showcasing some of the largest crocodiles in Australia with return transfers from Broome accommodation and the visitor centre included.

Enter the apex predators kingdom through the iconic mighty jaws of a giant saltwater croc to gaze upon over 2,500 large, scaly creatures in Broome. At 3 pm, the crocodile feeding exhibition begins. See crocodiles bathe in the sunlight in crocodile alley where they await their daily feed.

There is also plenty of time to roam the park and explore the colourful birdlife, cassowary, kangaroos, emus, dingoes and more that live here during a guided tour. Guests can even have their photos taken with the crocodile handlers and hold a baby croc. Complimentary return transfers will have you back in Broome in time for dinner.

properties.name: Buccaneer and Horizontal Falls Scenic Flight
properties.description:
From dramatic red cliffs, azure seas, lush rainforest and magnificent waterfalls, the Kimberley is a place of absolute wonder. Lifting off from Broome, your pilot will take you over this renowned region on a magical scenic flight. 

Prepared to be wowed as you head over Horizontal Falls, described by David Attenborough as 'one of the greatest wonders of the natural world.' Continue over Koolan and Cockatoo Island before soaring above Buccaneer Archipelago, home to 1000 islands made of Precambrian sandstone over two billion years old.

Highlights: 

- Marvellous views of Horizontal Falls and the Buccaneer Archipelago
- Stopover at Ardyaloon (One Arm Point) community
- Visit the Ardyaloon Trochus Hatchery and Aquaculture Centre
- Fly along the bays and beaches of the Dampier Peninsula
- Breakfast/lunch and morning or afternoon tea provided
- Return scenic flights from Broome

properties.name: Dolphin Watching and Scenic Marine Cruise
properties.description:
Cruise around the waters of the Mandurah region in Western Australia with this Dolphin and Scenic Marine Cruise. With the 1 hour and 15 minute experience, you'll cruise along the canals to spot wild dolphins playing the water while admiring the beautiful views of the region. There are around 75 to 100 bottlenose dolphins living in the waters off Mandurah and this cruise is the perfect way to get up close to them.

While on board you'll be treated to commentary about the region and the animals that live in the waters including the dolphins you'll be seeing. Departing daily, this cruise will also take you past some of the most luxurious homes on the canals and some historic pioneer sites.

The cruise departs at 10am, 11.30am, 1.30pm and 3pm (10am available weekends and school holidays only). 

Highlights
- Cruise through the city's calm, inland waterways and luxurious canals
- Spot playful wild dolphins as they feed and play in their natural environment
- Watch a western rock lobster catch demo & see this iconic creature up close
- Spot pelicans, ospreys and swans on the region's wetlands of world importance
- Enjoy live commentary by our expert marine guides
- Kids can play at the Steering Centre (built in Captain's Wheel w/ Binoculars)

properties.name: Murray River Scenic Cruise
properties.description:
Climb aboard in Mandurah and kick back ready for a scenic cruise and delicious two course lunch. Beginning with the waterways of Mandurah, you'll take in gorgeous views and luxurious homes sitting on the banks of the canals. 

After viewing an abundance of birdlife through the Creery Wetlands you'll venture to Peel Inlet, the breeding and feeding spot of many bottlenose dolphins.

Highlights:

- Cruise the beautiful canals of Mandurah
- 4.5 hour tour exploring Mandurah's winding waterways
- Two course buffet lunch served on board as you cruise the Murray River
- Stop off at Coopers Mill for a guided tour (weather permitting)
- Admire the luxury waterfront homes built on the canals
- Spot native birds and wild dolphins

properties.name: Swan Valley Food and Wine Tour
properties.description:
Relax and enjoy a full day of indulgence as you sample our way through the best of the Swan Valley. There is one word of warning though with this tour, don't plan a big dinner after this one!!

Your tour includes wine-tasting at four quality wineries, delicious lunch with complimentary glass of beer/wine/cider/softdrink at Homestead Brewery. following lunch indulge in a cheeseboard, a beer sample at a microbrewery and chocolate tasting.

Highlights:

- Visit 5 quality Swan Valley wineries
- Vineyard platter lunch
- Beer tastings
- All wine tasting fees included
- Chocolate tastings
- Cheese platter

properties.name: Mandurah Dolphin Watching and Scenic Marine Cruise
properties.description:
Cruise around the waters of the Mandurah region in Western Australia with this Dolphin and Scenic Marine Cruise. With the 1 hour and 15 minute experience, you'll cruise along the canals to spot wild dolphins playing the water while admiring the beautiful views of the region. 

There are around 75 to 100 bottlenose dolphins living in the waters off Mandurah and this cruise is the perfect way to get up close to them.

**Highlights**  

-   Spot dolphins as they feed & play in their natural environment
-   World class Mandurah Ocean Marina to see unique houseboats & yachts
-   Wetlands teeming with birdlife including ospreys & other amazing water birds
-   Kids can play at the Steering Centre
-   Informative commentary by expert marine guides
-   Cruise through the city’s calm, inland waterways & luxurious canals

properties.name: Augusta Whale Watching Cruise
properties.description:
Swap the wildlife doco for a real life encounter with Humpback Whales on this two hour Augusta whale watching cruise. Travel to the humpback highway for a front row seat to witness the natural phenomena of the pods of whales as they migrate north to mate. Pods of males are often sighted putting on a show for the female whales in search of a mate while endangered Southern Right Whales use the bay to calve and build up the strength of their young whales before they continue the miraculous journey.

Available from May to August this whale watching cruise is a spectacular way to witness the magic of human nature on display before your eyes. Join the captain with 360 degree views of the sea from numerous spacious desks on the vessel. Your Augusta whale watching cruise is made richer with a marine biologist onboard to provide fascinating commentary as you witness a number of common whale behaviours on the day. Whether it’s your first time or tenth time, no whale watching tour is alike. Scoop up your whale watching tickets this season, before they sell out!

Highlights: 

- Purpose built whale watching vessel
- 5 viewing platforms over 3 Levels
- Luxury lounges and viewing decks
- Unlimited tea, coffee & biscuits
- Complimentary postcard and photo's
- Under water camera & microphone

properties.name: Mammoth Caves Tour
properties.description:
Lying beneath the surface of Leeuwin-Naturaliste Ridge, a series of decorated limestone caves can be found. Join this guided tour of the Mammoth Caves in Margaret River and wander through the caves while listening to an informative io tour that leads you around the majestic chambers.

The Mammoth Caves are the most accessible of all caves in Margaret River with boardwalks and platforms that are wheelchair accessible for all guests. Marvel at this natural time capsule and ancient fossil including the remains of Australian Megafauna that have been extinct for approximately 46,000 years. The Mammoth Caves are open daily between 9am to 5pm with the last entry to the caves at 4pm.

Inclusions
- Self-guided io tours of the Mammoth Cave
- Access to the interpretative centre onsite
- Highlights
- Listen to fascinating io as you wonder the Mammoth Cave
- View the 50 000 year old 'zygomaturus' jawbone in the cave wall
- Explore at your own pace and enjoy the magnificent forest on the way back

properties.name: Scenic Flights From Kalbarri to Monkey Mia and Beyond
properties.description:
Experience the beautiful WA coastline on this 5 hour tour with return scenic flights over Monkey Mia PLUS 2.5 hours free time to encounter Bottle Nose Dolphins in their natural environment on a white sandy beach! Scenic flights begins from Kalbarri airport to view the impressive coastline, Zuytdorp Cliffs and historic shipwrecks. 

Take to the skies and fly alongside the cliffs at Womerangee Hill before heading south to Shark Bay and Monkey Mia. 

**Highlights** 
- Enjoy a 5-hour scenic flight 
- Dolphin encounter at Monkey Mia 
- Hug the coastline flying past Zuytdorp Cliffs 
- Fly past Womerangee Hill 
- Enjoy 2.5 hours on the white sandy beach 
- Experiencing Bottle-Nose dolphins being fed

properties.name: Rottnest Island Ferry Transfers from Fremantle
properties.description:
Purchase your Rottnest Island ferry return transfers from Fremantle here to enjoy a day on this island paradise off the coast of Western Australia. In just 30 minutes, the Rottnest Island ferry will arrive at this natural playground where you'll have plenty of time to discover the secluded beaches and bays and even spot a Quokka or two. 

Rottnest Island offers a range of activities to suit everyone including bus tours, bike rental, snorkel tours, surfing, fishing, guided walks, bus tours and more. You will have over 6 hours of free time to explore the island at your leisure.

**Highlights** 

- A wide array of scenery, wildlife & white sandy beaches
- A true haven of wildlife and wonder
- Explore hidden beaches, caves, bays and inlets
- Rottnest Island has a large range of activities
- Rottnest boasts an incredibly rich heritage
- Over 63 beaches and 20 bays

properties.name: Blue Tongue Photo Tours
properties.description: Improve your photography skills while on location in spectacular Western Australia with one of Australia's most experienced commercial photographer & landscape shooters - Martial Fatton. Hands-on Courses, Tours & Adventures 'Take only pictures, leave only footprints' Photography Outline: Improve your photography skills, learn how to better understand light and composition. Check what's in the bag as we discuss trade tools, tricks and tips. This day tour is suitable for beginners and experienced photographers of all ages. Each itinerary has been carefully put together with the help of local boutique travel operators, allowing you to experience a diversity of landscape and lighting. We guarantee a wealth of photographic opportunities, including small group tuition, practical notes and one-to-one support tailored to your individual needs. Explorers with a passion for photography and travel will have a unique opportunity to work with a professional photographer whilst enjoying fine local food and sharing a few stories. What to bring Your favourite camera and lens, plenty of memory cards, fully charged batteries. Don't forget to bring your camera manual and a tripod if you have one. Sturdy shoes, hat and sunscreen is essential.

properties.name: Ocean Park Aquariam and Shark Feeding
properties.description:
Ocean Park is an award-winning, eco-friendly aquarium located on the pristine shores of the Shark Bay Marine Park in Western Australia. Whether taking in the wonders of the ocean with a guided tour of the aquarium, enjoying spectacular views from Oceans Restaurant or exploring the Shark Bay World Heritage Area on a 4WD tour, you are sure to find that Ocean Park will deliver an experience unlike any other. Shark Bay Dive and Marine Safaris is the newest part of the Ocean Park business and the only PADI Dive Centre in Shark Bay. We specialise in scuba diving, snorkelling and scenic wildlife tours of Steep Point and Dirk Hartog Island. We focus on small groups and personal service taking guests to some of the most remote and pristine areas in Australia.

Our mission is to protect and conserve the marine environment and inspire our visitors to appreciate the oceans. This is achieved through imparting accurate scientific information and conveying messages of sustainability and conservation in a fun, passionate and educational manner.

properties.name: Penguin and Seal Islands Kayak Tour
properties.description:
Spend a fun-filled day exploring Penguin and Seal Islands by sea kayak. Get up close and personal with the Australian Sealions, Penguins and hundreds of seabirds, take a guided walk to explore Penguin Island and enjoy snorkelling (snorkelling available from November to March only)

Paddling a sea kayak is a unique and intimate way to explore Penguin & Seal Islands. Get up close and personal with the sea lions, cruise past colonies of pelicans and take in the rugged islands. Tours are led by a qualified instructor who will take you on a guided walk and snorkelling (in the warmer summer months) on Penguin Island. Sometimes we even see the dolphins! It's a fun filled day suitable for beginners and advanced paddlers. Please note participants must weigh less than 115kgs, be at least 8 years of age, be able to understand basic English instructions and are required to sign a waiver of liability prior to participating. Activities we offer: - Visiting the sea lions at Seal Island often that often swim and jump playfully amongst the kayaks! - Silently gliding over shallow reefs - Exploring secluded bays and getting up close to the islands all within an easy 700 metre to 1km distance offshore - easy paddling for beginners! - Getting a close-up water level view of the wildlife. - Swimming from beautiful sandy beaches and snorkelling colourful reefs with your tour guide (November to March only). - Seeing the little penguins at the Discovery Centre and then enjoying an island picnic lunch under the trees overlooking sweeping views of the marine park. - Double sit in kayaks (traditional sit insides with rudders), paddles and life vest - Guided walk & snorkelling (all equipment provided) on Penguin Island What to bring: - Bring along long-sleeved sun shirts & hats - Pack some dry bags to keep your valuables dry - Bathers, thongs or sandals in summer - A warm jacket in the cooler months - A change of clothes for after your paddle or snorkel - Drinking water, sunscreen, towel and camera Costs: Adults $180 Concession (8- 18 years) $162 Frequently Asked Questions: What is the minimum age? - Minimum age is 8 years old What if I can't swim? - Non-swimmers are welcome, life jackets are provided Are bookings essential? - Yes bookings are essential due to catering requirements. What if there is bad weather? - If we cancel due to bad weather, we will either re-schedule your tour or refund your full booking fee. Some booking agents may charge an administration fee, we do not.

properties.name: Turtle Tour by Sea Kayak and Snorkel Tour
properties.description:
Spot turtles, rays, schools of fish and more from your double sit-on-top sea kayak in the sheltered, shallow waters Snorkel from the 'Kayak Only' moorings in the sheltered waters of the Bundegi Sanctuary Zone Small group tours with a maximum of 8 guests.

INCLUDES: Double sit-on-top sea kayaks PFDs (lifejackets) Snorkelling gear: Snorkel, mask, fins, wetsuits in season, long sleeve sun shirts, broad brim hats, dry bags for valuables, snacks to re-energise, pick up/drop off from your Exmouth town accommodation and complimentary tour photos taken by your guide.

YOU BRING: Drinking water, sunscreen, sunglasses bathers/ board shorts, towel and camera.

Exmouth Adventure Co is your gateway to thrilling outdoor experiences in the heart of Western Australia's coastal paradise. Nestled in the picturesque town of Exmouth, this adventure company specializes in curating unforgettable journeys for nature enthusiasts, adrenaline junkies, and explorers of all levels. With a team of passionate and knowledgeable guides, Exmouth Adventure Co offers a wide range of activities, including snorkeling and diving in the vibrant Ningaloo Reef, kayaking through pristine waters, 4x4 tours to remote landscapes, and wildlife encounters like swimming with majestic whale sharks and manta rays.

properties.name: Foreshore Beach Aboriginal Walking Tour
properties.description:
A culturally informative 90 minute walk and talk tour right in the heart of Broome (on Djugun and Yawuru Country). Meeting down at the Town Beach area, followed by a short (easy grade) walk to the Red Cliffs. Once at the Red Cliffs, experience a Welcome to Country in language and in English followed by a Smoking Ceremony.

Enjoy local bush tucker and bush tea whilst being taught some of Pat’s local language, listening to dream time stories and stories specific to the site of her birth place.

properties.name: Dampier Peninsula Full Day Adventure
properties.description:
Head to the Dampier Peninsula located in the magnificent Kimberley region in North West WA. Start your journey by boarding the custom build 4WD tour truck, then settle in for a scenic drive travelling north, taking in the unbeatable landscapes of the region. Stop and explore the Beagle Bay Aboriginal Community, and enjoy a tasty morning tea before heading off to the stunning Cygnet Bay Pearl Farm. After an in depth tour of the farm, take a seat overlooking the turquoise waters of the King Sound and indulge in a tasty lunch at the farm’s restaurant.

After lunch, you will head to the One Arm Point Aboriginal Community and Jogolo Beach, where you won’t be able to resist taking a refreshing dip in the pristine waters. Keep an eye out for dolphins and turtles as you look out from the Round Rock viewpoint. 

Tour the Ardyaloon Trochus Hatchery and Aquaculture Centre where you’ll learn about the Bardi-Jawi people’s strong connections to their salt water traditions. Watch the incredible tidal flows of the Buccaneer Archipelago from the lookout, before heading back for a scenic drive to Broome, arriving at approximately 6:30pm.

properties.name: King George Sound Safari
properties.description:
King George Sound Safari is a boat tour company that offers whale watching and scenic tours in King George Sound, Albany, Western Australia. 

King George Sound is a beautiful and diverse marine environment, home to a variety of whales, dolphins, seals, and seabirds.

properties.name: Manta ray and Snubfin Dolphin Safari
properties.description:
Soak up the scenery on this unforgettable Broome sunset eco cruise in search of Snubfin dolphins, turtles, manta rays and more. Explore Broome's spectacular coastline and get up close with these inquisitive creatures with a Marine Biologists joining you aboard this afternoon Broome cruise.

Passengers will have uninterrupted views from the safety and comfort of our vessel, where you get up-close and personal with the marine wildlife of Broome! Relax in comfort on one of shaded daybeds and enjoy refreshing beverages and canapes while learning about the spectacular Roebuck Bay marine park.

Cruising along Gantheaume Point, Redell Beach, Entrance Point and Roebuck Bay, you'll learn all about the local flora and fauna and finish the eco cruise with a show stopping Broome sunset on the water. This sunset coastal cruise is set to be a highlight of your trip to Broome. Book your tickets here!

Inclusions
- Return transfers in air-conditioned comfort
- Delicious hot and cold canapes
- Non-alcoholic beverages

properties.name: Jesters Flat Horse Rising Country Lane Tour
properties.description:
Take an easy horse ride through premium Margaret River countryside and along the winding bush tracks. This escorted tour is ideal for groups of mixed abilities. The pace is relaxed however there is an opportunity to trot and canter on this ride. The experienced guides will give you the chance to try out some of your horse riding skills while keeping the group safe and controlled! If you would prefer to stay at a walking pace for the entire ride, we suggest you consider the 1hr Beginners Bushride. As with all our tours, we escort the group out into the bushland with highly capable guides, to ensure we can cater for a mixture of different riding skill levels. Please let us know if you have particular requirements. Relax afterwards with warm hand towels, cold drinks and hot bread! Suitable for all abilities from beginners to advanced.

In addition to horse-related activities, visitors can enjoy camping, glamping, and comfortable accommodations. Jesters Flat is a remarkable destination for those seeking a unique and memorable outback adventure in Australia's stunning countryside.

properties.name: Cliffs and Caves Kayak Tour
properties.description:
Introduction Our Cliffs & Caves Tour takes you by kayak to explore the stunning and imposing limestone cliffs of Blackwall Reach. This 500m section of weathered and majestic formations, is one of the Swan River's special places, will leave you awestruck. 

Our highly capable, experienced, local guides will share stories with you, from first Australians to the first European Swan River Colonists as well as some of the areas historical, cultural, geographical and horticultural secrets. So come join us on this fun, upbeat and wonderfully engaging small group tour and actively connect with nature. We paddle tandem kayaks and cater for a wide range of ages and skill levels, aiming to leave you energised and with a strong sense of accomplishment. Tour overview We meet and launch at East Fremantle Yacht Club and paddle slowly upriver through Bicton Bay, hugging the riverbanks. Here we take the time to admire the eclectic mix of houses, houseboats and watercraft all while enjoying the peace and serenity that is found whilst kayaking. 

We continue our paddle through the crystal clear waters towards the Blackwall Reach cliffs and spend time taking in the natural beauty the limestone caves, crevices and water bird nesting sites in the Swan River's deepest location. Our paddle includes several 'raft ups' where we get together 'mid-stream' for a chat and a story. A short paddle then sees us disembarking back at our start point and finishes at the members only East Fremantle Yacht Club to enjoy the very scenic setting over a well-earned coffee, tea or soft drink. 

Paddle duration & rating: The Cliffs & Caves Kayak Tour is a slow paddle for approx. 45min up river to the Blackwall Reach cliffs. Whilst there is boat traffic in this area, the river here is quite wide and we hug the opposite shoreline to the traffic. The area we paddle in is tidal and subject to wind, depending on the day/season. Some people will experience short durations of elevated heart rate depending on the wind. The paddle back is approx. 30 minutes. This tour is rated EASY to MEDIUM. 

What is included: Your kayak, paddle and life jacket Safety induction. Kayaking /paddling briefing - introduction to paddling, do's and dont's A 'Dry Bag' to help protect your wallet, keys and phone Knowledgeable guide - trained to keep you safe and show and provide you interesting information The guide also carries a first aid kit for your safety Covid-19 restrictions Our kayaks are two person craft. At all times on the tour please remember to practice safe social distancing. 

What to wear & bring You need to bring your own weather protection clothing including a hat Sunscreen A full water bottle Shoes that can be worn in the water eg: reef shoes, wet-suit shoes, sandals or even old sandshoes (not essential).

oilets There are public toilets located at the East Fremantle Yacht Club so just ask our tour guide if you need to use the amenities. You can also use these for changing clothes if necessary. Start & finish locations We start and finish at East Fremantle Yacht Club, Petra Street, East Fremantle. We launch from a grassed section and small beach just on the eastern side of the yacht club. Once you have booked this tour you will receive an email with instructions on where to park and a map on where to meet. Things to consider Children under the age of 18 years must be accompanied by an adult. Minimum age for participation in a kayak tour is 8 years old. Tandem kayaks have a maximum weight limitation of 125kg per person and 250kg per kayak.

properties.name: Leeuwin Estate - Wine Tasting and Immersion Experience
properties.description:
The Leeuwin Estate immersion experience is a great introduction to the award-winning Margaret River winery near Perth. Come visit the winery to enjoy a delicious morning tea with a coffee and cake overlooking the Karri forest. 

Your host will then lead you on a tour of the Leeuwin Estate art gallery and take you on a behind the scenes tour of the winemaking process.

Of course, you couldn't leave the Margaret River winery without sampling the fresh drops including five of the art series labels which are paired with matched canapes. 

The 90 minute Margaret River wine tasting tour is available daily from 10.30 am and is one of the top things to do in Perth.

**Highlights**
-   Relaxed introduction to the estate
-   Behind the scenes winery tour
-   Morning tea, coffee and cake
-   Onsite Australian art gallery
-   Wine and canapes pairing
-   Private alfresco verandah setting

properties.name: Coral Bay Turtle Tour
properties.description:
Coral Bay Ecotours' Turtle Tour is the best way to view turtles feeding in their natural surroundings. The experienced crew and their in-depth knowledge of our local turtles species and behaviour, will show you the best way to view these amazing animals. As the only turtle tour conducted on a glass bottom boat, this great value tour also provides you with the opportunity for coral viewing, fish feeding and snorkelling at two specially selected sites. Snorkelling gear is provided and coffee/tea/milo and biscuits are also included.

Coral Bay Ecotours is a renowned eco-adventure company located in the picturesque coastal town of Coral Bay, Western Australia. With a deep commitment to environmental conservation and sustainable tourism, they offer an immersive experience for nature enthusiasts and adventurers.

properties.name: Dolphin Discovery Centre Eco Cruise
properties.description:
The Dolphin Discovery Centre's Dolphin Eco Cruise is for 90 minutes within Koombana Bay. Our vessel provides an excellent viewing platform designed to get you as close as possible to the dolphins without getting your feet wet. 

The team will introduce you to our local Bottlenose Dolphins as they interact in their natural environment. Many of the Dolphins seen on the cruise call Koombana Bay their home. They can be seen frolicking, playing, sleeping and feeding during the cruise. The informative commentary from the skipper of the boat will also keep you updated throughout the cruise.

Dolphin Discovery Centre is a renowned marine education and conservation facility located in Bunbury, Western Australia. Situated along the picturesque shores of Koombana Bay, the centre offers visitors a unique opportunity to connect with the fascinating world of dolphins and other marine life. With a mission to promote environmental awareness and stewardship, the centre provides a range of immersive experiences.

Visitors can observe wild bottlenose dolphins in their natural habitat from the purpose-built Interaction Zone, where expert guides share insights about these intelligent creatures. The centre also features interactive displays, informative exhibitions, and hands-on activities to educate guests about marine ecosystems, biodiversity, and the importance of conservation.

properties.name: Tasman Holiday Parks - Albany
properties.description:
Tasman Holiday Parks - Albany is a beautiful holiday, caravan and camping park located in Western Australia's South West in the much loved town of Albany. The fabulously maintained grounds are full with lush plants and trees year round making this accommodation a real pleasure. There are many events and activities that go on year round in this town for singles, couples or family entertainment. 

We have a fantastic selection of motorhome sites are all grassed mostly with double concrete pads, driveways and are situated in spacious and magical garden setting. You are able to purchase Ensuite Powered Camping Sites, Powered Camping Sites and Unpowered Camping Sites which are all close to amenities and facilities that are available, such as the Laundry, Bathroom, Activity Room, Pool, Playground and BBQ area. 

We have pet friendly sites and accommodation options too!

Other accommodation options include Family Cabins, Standard Cabins and Studio Cabins, which are all self-contained and come complete with bathrooms, a TV, reverse cycle air-conditioning and microwave ovens.

properties.name: Mandurah Pirate Cruise
properties.description:
All aboard for a scenic 45 minute pirate cruise on the stunning Mandurah waterways near Perth. As you cruise along the picturesque canals take the opportunity to steer the pirate wheel and keep a lookout for enemy pirates peering through the telescopes. The family friendly cruise even comes complete with crew dressed as pirates. 

The short journey along the Mandurah coastline combines sightseeing with a small dose of adventure as you cruise past luxury waterfront homes and often bottlenose dolphins are spotted while out on the water.

Highlights:

- Checkout the prestigious homes on the Mandurah Canal
- Fun for the whole family let our pirate crew entertain you with silly jokes and the pirate code
- Let the kids imagination run wild as they fire the water cannons, ring the bell or steer the ship.
- A light hearted way to explore Mandurah's inland waterways
- Fun for the whole family
- Lookout for local wildlife including dolphins, black swans and Pelicans

properties.name: Fremantle Village
properties.description:
Fremantle Village is a 3.5 star rated caravan park and 3.5 star accommodation village. We are only 3kms from the heart of Fremantle and a half hour drive to Perth.  A short stroll to the beautiful South Beach and Shopping Centre.

Fremantle Village is the only caravan park and accommodation village in the City of Fremantle. They offer a range of accommodation to suit all budgets from park cabins, chalets, dedicated mobile home area, powered and un-powered caravan and tent sites. Short and long term accommodation is available with special rates for long term stays. Their van sites are large, private and away from the main road offering you a secure and quiet stay. Located in a very popular and sought after location situated only three kilometres south from the heart of the port of Fremantle and 500 metres from the beach. This is is a family-owned business and they take pride in providing friendly service and clean grounds, facilities and accommodation. Explore and enjoy the delights and surrounds Fremantle has on offer - from the famous cappuccino strip, Fremantle Markets or catch a ferry and visit the beautiful and unique Rottnest Island. They offer free pick up and drop off to Rottnest Island ferry operators and have a wealth of information available on all tourist destinations and attractions. Fremantle Village is close to public transport and only 500 metres from the beach. Pets are welcome on the sites, sorry no pets are allowed in the accommodation.

properties.name: Sunset Beach Holiday Park
properties.description:
We are a peaceful retreat on the beach, yet far away from the associated hustle and bustle. 

It's the ideal location for your next family holiday - to relax and unwind for a few days whilst touring, and is the ideal spot to rest over when travelling to and from Perth. 

At Sunset Beach you decide the type of holiday you want - camping, caravanning or relaxing in our chalets. All campsites and chalets are a short walk from the beachfront and is the perfect location for windsurfing, beach fishing, a stroll along the foreshore or to enjoy a glass of wine while watching the magnificent sunsets over the Indian Ocean.

properties.name: Tasman Holiday Parks - Ledge Point
properties.description:
Our Park welcomes you to relax and unwind in the Cray fishing town of Ledge Point. Our location is ideal for weekend getaways, midweek escapes, or a stopover en-route to the Pinnacles at Cervantes. 

Ledge Point is approx. an hour and a half drive north of Perth. We are a dog-friendly caravan park, however not permitted in peak periods.

properties.name: BIG4 Middleton Beach Holiday Park
properties.description: Sheltered by the calm waters of King George Sound, beautiful BIG4 Middleton Beach Holiday Park is located on 500 metres of world class beach frontage offering everything from safe swimming for children to surfing, kite surfing, fishing and whale watching in season. Enjoying the spectacular coastline, scenic walkways and just  3.2km from Albany

properties.name: Derby Visitor Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Plantation Caravan Park
properties.description: We look forward to welcoming you to our Holiday Park set amongst tropical fruit plantations along the Western Australia's Coral Coast  Wireless Internet. BBQs, pool, playground and so much more!

properties.name: BIG4 Dongara Denison Beach Holiday Park
properties.description: Just under 4 hours north of Perth in the Coral Coast region, our park enjoys an idyllic absolute beachfront location and is adjacent to the marina at Port Denison. As well as being the regions Lobster Capital of WA, from June-October each year this region also boasts the most beautiful natural array of wildflowers to be seen in Australia.

properties.name: BIG4 Acclaim Prospector Holiday Park
properties.description: BIG4 Acclaim Prospector Holiday Park in Kalgoorlie is conveniently located at the centre of the action, on the corner of the Great Eastern Highway. Our accommodation is varied and caters for families, couples and single travellers as well as caravan and camping sites for those on the road.

properties.name: Drummond Cove Holiday Park
properties.description:
At Drummond Cove Holiday Park, we have accommodation to suit all budgets, including powered and unpowered sites, self-contained vehicle sites, and a range of cottages.

We have a camp kitchen and laundry for your convenience, as well as a fully stocked shop with basic items. There is a walking track that will lead you straight to the local beach.

properties.name: BIG4 Breeze Holiday Parks - Busselton
properties.description:
A short walk from the ocean and a stone’s throw to Western Australia’s famous wine region, BIG4 Breeze Holiday Parks - Busselton is perfectly positioned for your next getaway. This vibrant seaside town boasts Australia’s longest jetty, an event calendar full of artistic and cultural celebrations, iconic beaches and epic fishing.

BIG4 Breeze Holiday Parks – Busselton is your home away from home. The place where memories are made. Dog-friendly and family-friendly, its a place you will return to time and time again.

properties.name: BIG4 Perth Midland Tourist Park
properties.description:
BIG4 Perth Midland features a heated outdoor spa-swimming pool, BBQ area and a fully-equipped camp kitchen. You can relax in our recreation room with comfortable lounges, library, large screen TV, complimentary tea/coffee, free WiFi, or enjoy a game of pool.

Our amenity blocks have just been refurbished to a high standard, with a dedicated separate unit for wheelchair users. Our guest laundry has coin-operated washers and dryers and you can watch TV while waiting for your washing. A dump point, set in pleasant surroundings, is easy to access. Free WiFi covers the whole area.

The Park features a seasonal creek and is surrounded by native gardens, creating a peaceful atmosphere. Major shopping and medical centres, public transport, caravan repairers, cafes and restaurants are all at the Park’s doorstep.

properties.name: BIG4 Denmark Ocean Beach Holiday Park
properties.description: Our park has a variety of options to suit everyone's holiday needs. Indulge in a Superior 3 or 2 bedroom Chalet or Cabin set in pristine surrounds. Offering manicured large flat sites welcoming all size of caravans and tents. Perfect for your home away from home real bush camping experience with all the modern facilities.

properties.name: BIG4 Bunbury Riverside Holiday Park
properties.description:
On the Eaton Foreshore, opposite the Collie River, BIG4 Bunbury Riverside Holiday Park is your perfect base to explore the delights of Bunbury and the wider South West region.

Whether you're seeking a relaxing family getaway, a stopover for exploring the region, or a comfortable base for outdoor adventures, our park caters to all. Choose from our range of cabins, caravan sites, and camping options, all designed for your comfort and convenience.

Unwind and reconnect:
-Relax by the 2 heated swimming pools.
-Let the kids loose on the jumping pillow, playground, and tennis court.
-Enjoy a BBQ with family and friends in our designated areas.
-Explore the nearby Collie River, ideal for fishing, crabbing, and boating.

Discover Bunbury and beyond:
-Located just 8km from Bunbury city center.
Minutes away from the Sanctuary and Bunbury Golf Courses.
-Easy access to shops, restaurants, and cafes.
-Ideal base for exploring the Margaret River wine region and the stunning beaches of the South West.

Book your Bunbury escape today and experience the BIG4 difference!

properties.name: Mount Barker Visitor Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: BIG4 Emu Beach Holiday Park
properties.description: Set in a relaxed natural environment, BIG4 Emu Beach Holiday Park is a gorgeous holiday destination 10 minutes from the center of Albany, Western Australia. Surrounded by native Peppermint trees and just meters from the beach, boasting large powered and unpowered caravan and camping sites, as well as a generous mix of accommodation to suit all budgets.

properties.name: Perenjori Tourist Centre & Pioneer Museum
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Morawa Tourist Information Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Moora Community Resource & Visitor Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Mingenew Tourist Information Centre
