properties.name: Northam Visitor Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: John Batten Community Hall
properties.description:
This is a parking lot with 5 places, especially for non-self contained vehicles. Tents are not allowed, but rooftop tents are. Maximum of 24 hours.

There are toilets, showers, BBQs, tables, garbage bins, taps and a playground. It's next to the sea.

properties.name: Galena Bridge Rest Area South
properties.description: This large overnight rest area with good amenities is located off the highway, on the bank of the Murchison River. There are plenty of trees scattered here and there for extra privacy and shade. Suitable for big rigs. Maximum stay is 24hrs.

properties.name: Tuarts Reserves Overnight RV Park
properties.description: 72 hrs max stay area with some picnic tables. There are no other facilities, so SC vehicles only, please!

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Woodman Point
properties.description:
Less than 15 minutes from the charming port city of Fremantle, take a break from the hustle and bustle of everyday life at Discovery Parks – Woodman Point (formerly Big4 Discovery Parks - Woodman Point). 

Boasting comfortable accommodation and outstanding park facilities, Discovery Parks – Woodman Point is the perfect oasis for those looking for a weekend getaway or a relaxing holiday for the whole family.

Entertain the kids with our bouncing pillow, playground or swimming pool or head to Woodman Point Ammo Jetty for a day. 

Once you’ve explored the park, make sure to visit Fremantle, famous for its Victorian and Georgian era and bustling with cafés, restaurants and stunning historical landmarks.

properties.name: Dunns Ecopark
properties.description:
Embrace nature's beauty at Dunns Ecopark, near Esperance.

Nestled amidst towering blue gum trees and pristine bushland, Dunns Ecopark offers an unforgettable eco-friendly escape.  Located just 40 kilometers east of Esperance, Western Australia, and bordering the world-renowned Cape Le Grand National Park, the park provides a unique opportunity to immerse yourself in the region's natural wonders.

Experience the tranquility of nature:
-Unwind at unpowered campsites nestled beneath a canopy of trees, ideal for self-contained vehicles and campers.
-Explore the surrounding wetlands and bushlands, teeming with diverse birdlife and native flora.
Enjoy the shared amenities, including a camp kitchen, BBQ facilities, picnic areas, and composting toilets.
Witness breathtaking sunrises and stargaze under the vast night sky.

Discover the awe-inspiring landscapes of Cape Le Grand National Park, known for its stunning beaches and rugged coastline.
Hike the numerous trails within the park, offering breathtaking views and diverse ecosystems.
Go for a refreshing swim at the nearby Dunns Rock Beach.

Dunns Ecopark: your gateway to a sustainable and unforgettable nature experience near Esperance.

properties.name: Hamelin Bay Holiday Park
properties.description:
Hamelin Bay Holiday Park is a place where holiday memories are made!
Located within the beautiful Leeuwin Naturaliste National Park, the park is established on a wide sweeping section of breathtaking bay. 

Our park features three amenity blocks with hot showers, disabled access and two laundries with dryers and washing machines for your convenience.

properties.name: Geraldton Belair Gardens Caravan Park
properties.description:
Belair Gardens is the closest Caravan Park to the City of Greater Geraldton. We are part of Summerstar Tourist Parks and a member of T Caravan Parks.We are one of the few parks in Western Australia to have achieved the Bronze Gumnut Award for Environmental Sustainability. 

Belair Gardens Caravan Park has a range of options for the travelling public. From our studio chalets to a 3.5 star spa unit. Linen is supplied on all our beds in Deluxe accommodation. For those bringing their own accommodation we offer unpowered, powered and powered ensuite sites. We have a new area for our 5-wheeler guests.

properties.name: Traditional Aboriginal Art Workshop
properties.description:
Join renowned Nyungar artist Justin Martin from Djurandi Dreaming in a beautiful location, in and around Perth for an art session you will not forget.
Learn symbols, stories and colours used in Nyungar art. Design a concept of Nyungar art in an engaging session while hearing about the local Indigenous history of the area and Nyungar language. Djurandi Dreaming is a certified Indigenous culture, tour and arts company based on Nyungar boodja in the Perth metropolitan area.

Art supplies included.

properties.name: The Bush Food Experience
properties.description: This 45-60 minute bushfood experience is a relaxing way to gain an introduction to traditional bush foods and local culture. Join the Rileys as you relax in the sunken bush food garden surrounded by native bush foods. Your guide Grant will Welcome you in language and share his history, traditional artefacts, storytelling and cultural heritage of the area and its First People. Roast quandong nuts over the fire whilst sampling Anne’s modern twist of emu pate, homemade jam, bush damper and tea.

properties.name: Sunset over the Ranges
properties.description:
Begin at the oldest Aboriginal Art Centre in WA, Waringarri, meaning big mob of people coming together. We welcome you to our meeting place. 

Walk with us, talk with us, let us show you our culture through art, culture, sound and story telling. Be inspired by our artists and experience the meaning behind our artwork. 

Drive your vehicle to a unique sunset location to share yarns and Miriwoong language. As the sun starts to set to the sounds of the didgeridoo, taste home-made damper and bush foods.

properties.name: Staircase to the Moon and Markets
properties.description:
You have to see it to believe it! 

This amazing natural phenomenon takes place along the Pilbara and Kimberley Coastline, when the full moon rising across the exposed tidal flats creates the impression of a staircase leading to the moon.

The Staircase appears along the shores of Roebuck Bay - Town Beach and the Mangrove Hotel are the most popular spots, with night markets at Town Beach complementing this special event. 

The Staircase to the Moon happens 2 - 3 days a month between March and October.

properties.name: Rock Art Tour Yaburrara Trail
properties.description:
Clinton Walker is a descendant of the Ngarluma and Yindjibarndi people, who are the Traditional Owners of the coastal and inland areas of the West Pilbara region. 

Clinton started Ngurrangga Tours to educate and immerse people in the ways of his culture and history so that they could understand more about Pilbara Aboriginal culture and country. 

Experience a Welcome to Country, see ancient rock art, visit sacred sites and hear traditional stories.

properties.name: On Country Tour with Yabbie Lunch
properties.description: Join Grant and Anne Riley at Lake Dumbleyung to learn about the Aboriginal history and the lake, once a significant food and water source for the Wilman people. Be welcomed in language and hear Grant's history, traditional artefacts, storytelling and cultural heritage. Visit the lookout tower at Pussy Cat Hill and enjoy spectacular views. Continue to the local emu farm to see the majestic birds up close, visit the yabbie farm to see the operations and sample freshwater delicacies.

properties.name: Local History and Culture
properties.description: In the relaxed setting of Maalinup Aboriginal Gallery, taste a variety of wild bush foods, explore the bush food garden and feed the emus. Our local history and culture talks introduce participants to traditional Aboriginal life, spirituality and social systems. Dreamtime stories are about creation and events that shaped the landscape and laid down rules for everyday life. We share some of these stories with our guests as you sample bush tucker snacks.

properties.name: Francois Peron 4WD Tour
properties.description:
Even before Shark Bay became a World Heritage Area, local Nhanda and Malgana Aboriginal people have been looking after this place. 

Learn about the amazing conservation work being done today to restore the balance of nature as we take you to find any number of native species and discover firsthand why this place is a World Heritage Site. 

We visit fantastic look outs like Skipjack Point, Point Peron where the Eastern Bay meets the Western Bay plus many other scenic locations.

properties.name: Emu Dreaming Emu Farm Tour
properties.description:
Your guide Grant will Welcome you in language and share his history, traditional artefacts, storytelling and cultural heritage. Roast quandong nuts over the fire and sample Anne's modern twist of emu pate, homemade jam, bush damper and tea. 

Travel to the local emu farm and view, walk with and feed the emus and tour the incubator and hatcher to collect emu eggs in season. 

Take photos and enjoy the natural surrounds before perousing the beautiful emu products.

properties.name: Dreaming in the Quay Perth Night Tour
properties.description:
Join your guide as you learn about Nyungar culture and are delighted by the visual attractions of Elizabeth Quay. Hear the Dreamtime story of the Maali (black swan) and learn about the Wadjuk tribe, the exclusion zone, stolen generation and assimilation act.

Hear about local native flora and fauna and learn about the local Nyungar people's diet, seasons, family structures, and neighbouring tribes.

properties.name: Djilgi Dreaming Yabbie Farm Tour
properties.description:
Join Grant and Anne Riley on an experience at Lake Dumbleyung in the Golden Outback region of WA to learn about the Aboriginal history. 

Relax in the sunken bush food garden surrounded by native bush foods as you're welcomed in language and hear Grant's history, traditional artefacts, storytelling and cultural heritage. 

Visit the local yabbie farm to see the operations, purchase local gourmet products and sample these freshwater delicacies and enjoy a gourmet lunch.

properties.name: Cape Cultural Experience
properties.description: Discover the hidden wonders of Cape Country in the spectacular Margaret River region of Western Australia. Learn of the connection to country and culture whilst enjoying lasting memories as your guide Josh Whiteland provides you with a deeper appreciation of the beautiful and inspiring Cape to Cape region.

properties.name: Bush Tucker Tour of Hearson Cove
properties.description: Enjoy a trip out on country with a Traditional Owner of the region for a Bush Tucker Tour of Hearson Cove. The landscape is full of edible fruits, roots, nuts, seeds and leaves and Aboriginal people have gathered, harvested and hunted this bush tucker for thousands of years. Experience coastal foraging, learn what is good to eat and where to find it and taste native bush tucker such as berries and bush potatoes.

properties.name: Bush Pharmacy Tour
properties.description:
Healing the natural way with fire and plant medicine has proven to work for adults and children. 

Learn to connect with nature and accompany Kangeang / Bibblemum Noongar woman Belinda on a journey swapping contemporary man made medicines to more organic natural products that can be found in our local bush. 

Learn to identify and collect plants and flowers in a culturally appropriate and sustainable way.

properties.name: Bungle Bungle Explorer
properties.description: Experience the natural wonders of the World Heritage listed Purnululu National Park on this full day tour from Broome. Track east over the beautiful turquoise waters of Roebuck Bay. Flyover the mighty Fitzroy River, the Fitzroy Crossing township and the stunning Geikie Gorge. Fly over and discover the scenic pattern around the Bungle Bungle Massif, before landing at the remote Bellburn airstrip, then enjoy spectacular walks through Country with Traditional Custodians.

properties.name: Bungle Bungle Adventure Safari
properties.description:
Departing Broome in your fixed wing aircraft tracks east over the beautiful turquoise waters of Roebuck Bay. Overfly the mighty Fitzroy River, the Fitzroy Crossing township and the stunning Geikie Gorge. 

Enjoy morning tea and refreshments at Halls Creek. Meet your local Gija tour guide and be Welcomed to Country before being guided on spectacular walks through Echidna Chasm and Cathedral Gorge with overnight accommodation at the Bungle Bungles Wilderness Lodge.

properties.name: Borrgoron Coast to Creek Tour
properties.description:
Join Terry Hunter, a fourth generation pearler and proud Bardi man from the Dampier Peninsula. Explore the mangroves, creeks and tidal flats of King Sound and experience the Bardi people's special relationship with the land and sea. Share an in-depth knowledge of bush food, medicine plants and traditional, sustainable hunting and fishing practices.

Forage for oysters, hear Terry's stories and along the way discover a culture that has lived in harmony with this country for thousands of years.

properties.name: Aboriginal Astronomy
properties.description:
Begin with a 30-40 minute storytelling session with highly respected Aboriginal Elder, Dr Noel Nannup. Following the storytelling, our Astronomers together with Noel will show you the spectacular night sky with a laser tour, pointing out interesting targets from both Western Science and Aboriginal perspectives. Later, take time to look through the telescopes, including the 25 inch Broad Hall telescope.

This is an awe inspiring experience, reminding us of how small we really are in the universe.

properties.name: Aboriginal Art and Dreamtime Stories
properties.description:
Create your own mini masterpiece. Watch a demonstration by Dale Tilbrook and then try your hand at dot art, painting a river stone or small canvas. Paints and equipment supplied. Experience Aboriginal Dreamtime stories, culture and life as Dale shares her stories with you. 

Explore the bush food garden. Feed the emus who are happy to pose for a photo opportunity. You also are treated to some of Dale and Lyall's famous bush tucker snacks during your art class.

properties.name: 4WD Tag Along Tour Welceome Country
properties.description:
Experience adventure with a 4WD Tag Along Tour! Join a convoy of off-road enthusiasts as you navigate rugged terrain and explore breathtaking landscapes. Follow a knowledgeable guide, conquer obstacles, and bond with fellow adventurers. Whether a novice or seasoned driver, these tours promise thrilling off-road escapades and unforgettable memories. Tour highlights:

4WD into stunning locations, Traditional Welcome to Country, Ancient Aboriginal Rock Art
Sacred Sites, Traditional Stories, Bush Medicine, Bush Tucker

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Swan Valley
properties.description:
Discovery Parks Swan Valley offers the perfect base for exploring the Swan Valley’s top attractions, just 14 km from Perth and 4 km from Guildford, one of the Valley's gateways.

Like all Discovery Parks, Swan Valley has something for everyone. With its proximity to the airport and major motorhome and car hire depots, it's a great spot to start or end your journey around Western Australia.

The park features modern, spacious cabins and studios, all air-conditioned, self-contained, and set in beautifully maintained grounds. You'll find a range of facilities designed for comfort and convenience.

Keep the kids entertained with a fenced swimming pool and pedal karts, or let them enjoy the movie room and campers' kitchen while you socialize. Plus, free WiFi is available throughout the park.

Located near popular attractions like wineries, restaurants, golf courses, Caversham Wildlife Park, and even a chocolate factory, there’s plenty to explore. The park also offers powered sites with ensuites, unpowered sites, and pet-friendly powered sites and cabins for a truly flexible stay.

properties.name: Mount Hart Wilderness Lodge
properties.description:
Nestled in a hidden oasis along the famous Gibb River Road, Mount Hart Wilderness Lodge is a popular base for adventurous travellers. With its unbeatable proximity to many of the region's major attractions, Mount Hart is the perfect gateway to explore the West Kimberley including the Horizontal Falls (just 40 mins away by helicopter) Buccaneer Archipelago, Twin Flame Falls, Bell Gorge, Tunnel Creek, Charnley River Gorge and much more.

Whether you're seeking a cozy camping experience, lavish glamping or a charming homestead retreat, Mount Hart offers accommodation for every kind of traveller. Take your exploration to new heights with our exclusive Helicopter Tours, where you'll soar above the rugged terrain and witness beautiful landscapes that are inaccessible by 4WD vehicles.

properties.name: Waringarri Art Centre Tour
properties.description: Your tour begins at the oldest Aboriginal Art Centre in Western Australia, Waringarri, meaning 'big mob of people coming together'. We welcome you to our meeting place. Walk with us, talk with us, let us show you our culture through art, culture, sound and story telling. Engage and be inspired by our artists and experience the meaning behind our artwork as you watch us painting in our own studios. Take this unique opportunity to see through the eyes of an artist as we paint and create.

properties.name: The Nyitting Experience
properties.description:
Experience Noongar ways of life, starting with a fire ceremony. Quieting your mind and focusing on the fire is one of the most powerful ways to heal your mind, body and soul. 

Your guide Belinda creates a learning circle as shown by elders on Country and shares the majestic Dreamtime stories about the spirit of creation and the serpent spirit - known as the Wagual. 

Join Belinda in singing and tapping through the 'Celebration Song' and hear the Noongar creation story.

properties.name: Quandong Beach Indigenous Experience
properties.description: This is a tag-along tour to Quandong Beach. Meet at the Women’s Centre in Broome before heading off in convoy to Ngumbarl/Jabirr Jabirr Country. Once at the culturally significant site you will be greeted with a Welcome to Country, Smoking and Water Ceremonies, allowing you to learn and reflect deeply about Aboriginal culture, the oldest continuous living culture in the world. Prepare the ground oven for your bush tucker feed, learn stories and dances of this beautiful country Pat calls home.

properties.name: Reddell Beach Women Only Tour
properties.description: Convoy to Reddell Beach and be immersed in a Welcome to Country, Smoking Ceremony and Water Ceremony. Aunty Pat will take you through each of these ceremonies explaining their meaning and the positive impact it can have on your personal well-being. Hear women’s stories of this culturally significant site as you wander up the beach. Sample bush tucker refreshments known for their healing properties for women’s health then learn some language words.

properties.name: Mirima National Park Walk
properties.description: Immerse yourself in the richness of Miriwong culture among the ancient escarpments of Mirima National Park in the Kimberley region of Western Australia. Listen as local Indigenous tour guides teach you about bush plants and their uses. Learn about the cultural importance of Mirima and the Indigenous history of Kununurra and its surrounds and visit WA's oldest Aboriginal art Centre, Waringarri, meaning �big mob of people coming together'.

properties.name: Mangrove Discovery Experience
properties.description: This two-hour Mangrove Discovery Experienceis a fun and engaging 2.8km walk in the mangroves and mudflats with local Aboriginal guide. Learn about the different types of mangrove trees. Experience the mangrove forest and hear about the traditional uses of mangrove wood. At low tide the mangroves are alive with mudskippers, mudcrabs and a variety of birds. Walking through tidal pools to Buccaneer Rock you will hear the Dreaming story of Randigunya the giant.

properties.name: Didgeridoo Dreaming Night Tour
properties.description:
Come and join us for an amazing night time adventure under a sky of magnificent stars as you are carried away by the ancient sounds of the didgeridoo. 

There's no other tour like it in Shark Bay and there's no other sound more synonymous with Australia's ancient landscape than the didgeridoo. It's resonant and tribal tones around an open campfire will transport you to another place, another time. 

Hear Dreaming stories and learn to play this timeless instrument.

properties.name: Bush Tucker Talk and Tasting
properties.description: In a relaxed setting at the Maalinup Aboriginal Art Gallery, taste a variety of wild bush foods such as quandong, native limes, sandalwood nuts and local coastal greens. Awaken your senses as you taste native herbs, spices and peppers. Discover the uses of bush tucker plants, their medicinal properties and the surprising health benefits they offer. Explore the bush food garden and feed the friendly emus. Wander the gallery and purchase any of the art or foods you have tasted during your tour.

properties.name: The Mangrove Discovery Experience
properties.description:
The Mangrove Discovery Experience is a fun and engaging 2.8km walk in the mangroves and mudflats with a local Aboriginal guide. You will learn about the different types of mangrove trees. At low tide the mangroves are alive with mudskippers, mudcrabs and a variety of birds. 

Later sit down, relax and experience the mesmerizing Staircase to the Moon. As the moon starts to rise across the mud flats you get your exclusive seats on the rock in the middle of Roebuck Bay for this natural phenomenon.

properties.name: Boya Kaarla Point Peron Cultural Tour
properties.description:
Meet at the beautiful Point Peron where crystal clear waters and rugged limestone cliffs await you. Your Nyungar guide will deliver a 1.5 hour walking tour starting with a traditional Welcome to Country on the foreshore. 

See the protected rock formations and caves which the Nyungar people used throughout the south west of Australia and view local native wildlife. 

Listen to local Dreamtime stories, hear about the connection that the Nyungar people have to this special location, Boya Kaarla.

properties.name: Riverview Tourist Park
properties.description:
Riverview is a unique property with amazing frontage to the beautiful Margaret River. Riverview prides itself on cleanliness of all cabins and the park in general and we look forward to welcoming you to our slice of paradise!

Riverview Tourist Park is located in the townsite of Margaret River, the renowned wine region of Western Australia. The park is a unique garden setting that undulates from the road down to some frontage to the river and on the other side is state forest with walking/riding tracks to town or east towards ten mile brook dam. A large range of cabins are available, most have en-suite, all have heating, cooling, linen and balcony with some overlooking the river. Free gas barbecues are located at the camp kitchen and at the riverfront along with a great gazebo and seating for large groups. Caravan and campervan bays are available (some with en-suite). Bird-life abounds at the park and they will often visit looking for a treat. You will be surprised that in this setting you are just a comfortable walk to the main street with all its attractions. Clean, comfortable accommodation at affordable prices. Come experience Margaret River!!!

Riverview cannot accommodate tents.

RV Dump point for registered guests only

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Port Hedland
properties.description:
Whether you visit for work or leisure, we guarantee your review of WA’s Pilbara region will include the word “unforgettable”. Our holiday park is perfectly located for both remote workers and holidaymakers. 

Discovery Parks – Port Hedland (formerly Cooke Point Holiday Park) is a great base for outdoor adventures, from off-road driving to coastal walks and endless fishing hot spots.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Busselton
properties.description:
Discovery Parks – Busselton is located in the picturesque Geographe Bay, just a three-hour drive (229km) south of Perth. A favorite holiday destination for Western Australians since the 1890s, Busselton is known for its stunning beaches, great fishing, fascinating caves, beautiful coastline, and lush bushland, all within reach. 

As one of the earliest settlements in Western Australia and the northern gateway to the Margaret River Wine Region, Busselton offers a wide variety of attractions in the heart of the state's "Natural Playground." 

With direct beach access to Geographe Bay, Discovery Parks – Busselton is the ideal spot to base yourself while exploring this breathtaking coastal region.

properties.name: Margaret River Tourist Park
properties.description:
Fully self contained cottage accommodation, to accommodate couples or families. Powered caravan/tourist sites, grass and paved. Camping sites with campers kitchen, TV room, Coin Guest Laundry, BBQ facilities.

Motel accommodation. Deluxe Cabins. Budget Cabins. All self contained kitchens. Powered and Ensuite caravan and motorhome sites.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Kalgoorlie Goldfields
properties.description:
If the idea of "rugged beauty" tickles your fancy, you're in for a treat at Discovery Parks – Kalgoorlie, Goldfields. Out here, you don't just look at the outback; you feel it, right in your dusty boots and sun-kissed nose.

Discovery Parks - Kalgoorlie Goldfields offers a comfortable and convenient stay with a variety of accommodation options, including modern cabins and spacious camping sites. Its location in Kalgoorlie makes it an ideal base for exploring the local history and natural attractions of the Goldfields region. 

Whether you're visiting for business or leisure, the park offers a welcoming retreat with all the necessary amenities.

properties.name: Seaspray Beach Holiday Park
properties.description: Spoil yourself when next you stay in Dongara at the only place that offers you a complete holiday experience.

properties.name: Aspen Karratha Village
properties.description:
An oasis in the Pilbara! Aspen Karratha Village is the premium accommodation for all your needs.

You will be pleasantly surprised by the resource-rich Pilbara, and Karratha is no different; take in the Red Earth Arts Precinct, venue out to Millstream-Chichester National Park for a swim or come to one of the only places in Australia you can see the famous Staircase to the Moon.

properties.name: Albany's Historic Whaling Station
properties.description:
Visit the only complete whaling station tourism attraction in the world! Albany's Historic Whaling Station was the last operating station in Australia and provides a fascinating insight into Albany's colourful past. Recognised as a heritage site, the whaling station is an engaging and educational tourism attraction for all ages to enjoy.

Find yourself immersed in the sights and sounds of the whaling industry. Enjoy short films within the converted whale oil tanks. Climb aboard the Cheynes IV, the world's only preserved Whale Chaser ship; see our giant blue whale skeleton; enjoy our world-renowned marine animal art collection and view our precious scrimshaw art. Visit our museum exhibits filled with authentic, whaling artefacts and memorabilia or relax in our cafe overlooking one of Albany's most picturesque bays. Our unique, biodiverse location is also home to over a 100,000 species of native plants which are now displayed in our Regional Wildflower Garden. Families can enjoy free BBQ's in the gardens and learn about our friendly collection of native animals at our Australian Wildlife Park. Join us for a memorable day on The Amazing South Coast.

Albany's Historic Whaling Station is a captivating historical site located in Albany, Western Australia. This museum and heritage center offers a remarkable glimpse into the region's whaling industry's rich and complex past. Established in 1978, the site showcases the fascinating history of whaling, focusing on the period from 1826 to 1978 when Albany was a hub for whaling operations.

properties.name: Norwesta Lifestyle Park
properties.description:
Cheapest Rates and Friendly Service! Come and visit Michelle and her staff at the Norwesta Lifestyle Park as well as experience Carnarvon, all year round holiday destination.

We hope you can find everything you need. Norwesta Lifestyle Park is focused on providing high-quality service and customer satisfaction - we will do everything we can to meet your expectations.

properties.name: Broome Fishing Charter
properties.description:
Absolute Ocean Charters is Australia's favourite, family-owned Broome Fishing Charter company. Discover the best of the north-west on one of our famous Broome Fishing Charters, a spectacular Whale Watching experience off Cable Beach, or a relaxing Snubfin Dolphin Eco Cruise in Roebuck Bay.

Welcome to Absolute Ocean Charters, we are an owner/operator business with over 20 years experience exploring the turquoise waters of Broome. Our aim is to provide exceptional value for money tours and first class service. We offer a variety of tours specialising in Full and Half day Reef Fishing, Creek Fishing and Mud Crabbing Charters. Whale Watching and Dolphin Tours, Roebuck Bay Sunset Cruises and Extended Stay Charters to the Rowley Shoals Or Kimberleys are on offer throughout the year. We also offer Exclusive Charters where you can customise a day to suit your needs, for your next party or corporate event.

Our mothership vessel "Contessa C" is a 20m Legend Design Aluminium Cruiser, powered by a 1300hp Cat engine. She has a top speed of 30kts and cruises effortlessly at 24kts to get you to the awesome grounds in no time.
"Contessa C" provides a huge shaded deck and plenty of comfortable sitting room to relax and soak up the beautiful environment
There is a full size toilet/shower onboard, kitchenette and air conditioned wheelhouse.

Absolute Ocean Charters provides everything you need to enjoy your day, including food, non alcoholic drinks, fishing gear and sunscreen.

We offer a complimentary air conditioned return transfer service from your accommodation.

Beginner or expert, our highly trained and very experienced staff will always be on hand to help you enjoy your day. Families and young children are welcome, you may wish to share a line with your child. We pride ourselves on an exceptional level of customer service and will take the time and effort to make your day the most enjoyable, whichever tour you choose!

properties.name: Cheela Plains Station Stay
properties.description: The STATION STAY offers an ideal stop over between the World Heritage Listed Ningaloo Reef and Karijini National Park. The facilities include a fully serviced air conditioned “multi” bedroom complex with shared kitchen and ablutions, camping areas, conference rooms, wireless internet access, cell phone coverage and approximately 150 square metres of undercover area.

properties.name: Cygnet Bay Pearl Farm & Accommodation
properties.description:
Cygnet Bay Pearl Farm Celebrating 80 years of pearling in 2021, this small family owned pearl farm 200km north of Broome has undergone a remarkable transformation from a hard working community of pearlers to a unique accommodation and touring destination for visitors to the Kimberley.

Our day area is open for 2WD vehicles (reception, restaurant, pool, tours and showroom) but all of our accommodation requires 4WD vehicles.

We have two seperate camping areas on site - Divers Creek, and Pearlers Village.


 - Divers Creek:
Our campsites are the perfect spot to relax and enjoy your surroundings. Situated just under a kilometre from the main farm village, reception area and restaurant in our Diver’s Creek accommodation area.

Our sites share access to a fully equipped camp kitchen and BBQ area and shared toilets and showers.

- Pearlers Village:
Set in a paperbark paddock our unpowered sites are the perfect spot to relax and enjoy your surroundings.

Located at Cygnet Bay and are 2WD accessible, suitable for most vehicles. These sites do not have power or water but have access to shared amenities, a fully equipped camp kitchen, and BBQ area.

They are suitable for up to six people (one vehicle per site), our campsites are the perfect spot to relax and enjoy your surroundings.

Situated just a short walk from the main farm village, reception area and restaurant in our Pearler’s Village accommodation area.

Due to our remote location, there is limited Telstra service and no WiFi available in our accommodation.

Due to our remote location, there is limited Telstra service and no WiFi available in our accommodation.

properties.name: Dongara Tourist Park
properties.description: Situated directly on the beachfront, Dongara Tourist Park offers Powered/ Unpowered sites and self-contained holiday cabins in Port Denison.

properties.name: Overlander roadhouse
properties.description: Free unpowered camping behind overlander roadhouse

properties.name: Leeman Caravan Park
properties.description:
Welcome to Leeman Caravan Park. This park is perfect for families, overnight stays and travelers of all ages. We have accommodation available to suit all holiday makers. You won't be disappointed! This range includes the following: suitable for caravans or camping: Cabins, Powered sites and un-powered sites. Dogs only allowed on powered or unpowered sites not in on site accommodation. 

With fantastic weather almost all year-round and the glorious Indian Ocean just a short walk away, Leeman Caravan Park is the perfect place to pitch your tent, park your van, or slip into one of our cabins and unwind. Please note no Dogs during busy period.

We have everything you need for your coastal holiday. There's a shop on-site and loads of facilities. So, come on down to Leeman - we'd love to see you!

Our Facilities
At Leeman Caravan Park, we aim to make your stay as relaxed and enjoyable as possible. We have a number of facilities to make your stay easy and relaxing. We have BBQ facilities and an undercover kitchen with tables and chairs You can dine in or out. There are sites with loads of shade from trees, grassed areas, and we even have a fish-cleaning area.

Accommodation
Of course there are plenty of spots for you to park your RV chariot or caravan. If you've got a tent or annexe, there are lots of spaces to settle in with them.

But if you'd prefer a cabin, we have those too. During busier holiday periods, it's a good idea to call ahead to make sure we've got what you want, but you'll always get a very warm welcome from our friendly and helpful staff.

Pet Friendly (Sites only)
Lots of people set off in their caravan and travel for weeks or months at a time. We get lots of grey nomads on their trip around Oz. And many of these humans have to have their best non-human mate with them. We ask for a cash bond of $30 and that you to keep your pooch on lead at all times, but we love to have all visitors including those with four legs. Dogs not permitted in or near Units and Cabins.

Great Fishing Spots
If you are keen on fishing, we have the Indian Ocean practically at our doorstep. There are plenty of places to fish and, of course, you can eat what you catch. There is even a place in our caravan park where you can clean and gut your catch, ready for our BBQ! And if you wish to buy fish, there are many local fishers who will sell you what they have just caught. There's nothing like fresh fish!

Operator hours 9am to 6pm with some variation. If arriving outside these hours, please call to arrange.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Lake Argyle
properties.description:
Discovery Resorts – Lake Argyle made famous for its incredible infinity pool, overlooking Australia’s second-largest man-made freshwater lake. Just a short drive south of Lake Kununurra, accommodation options range from camping sites and powered caravan sites to cabins and villas with breathtaking views!

Come and share a lifetime of experience exploring the remote bays of the stunning Lake Argyle Islands through our amazing boat tours, wildlife cruises and family-friendly activities. Or, for the ultimate in Lake Argyle cruising, hop aboard our custom-built tour vessel, the ‘Kimberley Durack’.

The immense freshwater lake formed by the damming of the mighty Ord River has created an amazing marine environment, discover it’s beauty and learn more about Discovery Resorts - Lake Argyle.

properties.name: Jurien Bay Tourist Park
properties.description:
Jurien Bay Tourist Park is only steps away from the beach, has on-site chalets, brand new holiday units, powered and unpowered camping sites and a huge jumping pillow for the kids.

Not only is the caravan park located right on the beautiful turquoise and cobalt blue beach side, it is also home to all the luxury facilities you’d expect from Summerstar Tourist Parks. We even have a great children’s area with a huge jumping pillow – perfect for the family vacationers. Enjoy our alfresco beachside café, multiple campers’ kitchens, beachside location, new luxury chalets and walking distance to all the main attractions in town.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Perth Airport
properties.description:
Touching down in Perth and craving a spot that’s more than just a pit stop? Look no further; Discovery Parks – Perth Airport is convenience with charisma, and it’s only a 15-minute hop from the terminal.

Discovery Parks - Perth Airport offers a range of accommodation options that cater to different types of travellers, whether you're just passing through or planning a longer stay. The park provides a peaceful environment with modern amenities, ensuring a comfortable and stress-free experience. 

With easy access to major roads and the airport, it's a perfect base for exploring Perth and its surrounding attractions.

properties.name: Treetops Adventure Yanchep
properties.description:
Unleash adventure just 45 minutes from Perth at Treetops Adventure Yanchep in the stunning Yanchep National Park.
Glide on 16 ziplines, spot Western Grey Kangaroos, and conquer 70+ aerial challenges in captivating bushlands. Your thrilling escape begins here!

properties.name: Kerriley Park Forest & Farmstay
properties.description: Kerriley Park Farmstay is the ultimate country getaway. Great fun for the young and young at heart. With 4 secluded self-contained cottages, nestled in a peaceful bush setting, whilst enjoying the animal interaction experience. We have a large number of animals for daily animal feeding activities. The huge playground and pool will keep the kids busy whilst the grown ups enjoy some of the local wine and produce from the privacy of the cottage verandahs. The native bush contains over 150 species of plant including spectacular wildflowers, and is home to wildlife such as kangaroos, bandicoots, and possums, great for a peaceful walk. All this enables both families and couples to spend their days on the property. When you do want to venture out we are positioned in the heart of the Margaret River region. Most of the South Wests major tourist attractions are within easy reach of us.

properties.name: Imintji Campground and Arts Centre
properties.description:
The Imintji (Ngarinyin) people invite you to stay at this sheltered location at the foot of the spectacular Wunaamin Miliwundi Ranges. 

This shady wilderness camp ground has wonderful views of the escarpment and is well situated to explore nearby natural attractions like Bell Gorge, Tunnel Creek, Windjana Gorge and surrounds. 

Once an important rest point for bullock drivers on the Gibb River Road, Imintji is once again a welcome stop-over for Kimberley travelers. 

The newly refurbished campgrounds offer modern amenities and is a great base from which to explore the Kimberley.

properties.name: El Questro Station Camping
properties.description: Located in the East Kimberley, El Questro is 700,000 acres of vast and stunningly beautiful terrain.

properties.name: Kalbarri Tudor Holiday Park
properties.description:
Kalbarri Tudor Holiday Park is an ideal holiday destination with a superb location. It is just a four-minute walk to the beach and to the town’s best restaurants, cafes, taverns, bakeries and shopping areas.

The park has shady, lush green lawns, a swimming pool, a camper kitchen, a TV Room, barbeques, a playground (with a jumping pillow) and a friendly atmosphere.

Choose from self-contained new cabins or recently refurbished villas and units, in studio, one and two-bedroom configurations.

There are lovely grassed and hard stand caravan and camping sites that are located amongst the trees near a mix of new and older-style shared facilities including full bathrooms. Ensuite and RV sites are also on offer.

Stunning Kalbarri, is surrounded by stunning beaches, the epic Kalbarri Skywalk and the gorges and river of Kalbarri National Park.

properties.name: Sandy Bay Holiday Park
properties.description:
Come and enjoy a quiet, shady, beachfront holiday park offering unique Rammed Earth and Swiss chalets as well as camping and caravan sites. Slow combustion fire places for your winter warmth, free wood is provided. Only 50m from the beach.

Sandy Bay is a quiet, shady, grassed beachfront park located 6km west of Busselton town centre. It is separated from the beach only by a cycleway which reaches past the town centre, Busselton's famous 2km Jetty and Underwater Observatory. We have 9 Swiss Chalets that sleep up to 4 people and 9 Rammed Earth Chalets that sleep up to 6 people. Prices are based on the first two people staying, any extra people pay $15 per person per night. $200 Bond collected on arrival for chalet bookings. Linen is included in the daily rate. Sorry no caravans larger than 22ft/6.7m long. We are a pet friendly Park but don't allow pets during school holidays. Please always let us know if you are planning on bringing your furry friend. In chalets we also charge a $25 one off pet fee ( to be paid on arrival). We also have a few Tent and Caravan Sites available. Due to size restrictions we only take bookings over the phone 08-9752 2003.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Bunbury Foreshore
properties.description:
Life by the water – there’s nothing quite like it. Perched at the edge of Koombana Bay, where long white beaches and sandy bay inlets stretch into the distance, is Discovery Parks – Bunbury Foreshore, the perfect holiday park for your south west coast adventures. 

It’s just a five minute stroll from your cabin, caravan or camping site to the idyllic town centre.

Swim, snorkel, fish, dive, meet bottlenose dolphins or go whale watching (seasonal only). Tour and taste your way through the acclaimed Geographe wine region or enjoy the unspoilt beauty of Big Swamp Wildlife Park and Beedelup National Park.

properties.name: Nullagine Caravan Park
properties.description: Nullagine Caravan Park features powered and unpowered sites, as well as cabins. Facilities include a kiosk, hot showers, campers� kitchen, laundry and a BBQ area. Call for more information and bookings.

properties.name: Bayview Coral Bay
properties.description: On the main street of a remote coastal village.

properties.name: Karijini Eco Retreat
properties.description: Karijini Eco Retreat is one of Australia’s leading eco-tourism attractions. Situated 1,500km north of Perth in WA’s second largest national park. Stay under the stars in our campground, or in comfortable glamping accommodation at the first and only facility to offer a glamping experience in the Karijini National Park.

properties.name: Violet Valley Campground
properties.description: As Violet Valley is a working station, we need advance notice of arrivals to ensure you can travel the access road safely during station operations.  Accommodation can be prebooked online through this website.

properties.name: Rest Area
properties.description: Rest area near the road. Camping near Indian Ocean Drive

properties.name: Ningaloo Caravan and Holiday Resort
properties.description: On a 9-hectare property, this rustic resort with chalets is 5.6 km from the Exmouth beaches and 50 km from Cape Range National Park. The casual chalets feature free Wi-Fi, TVs, DVD players and lounge/dining areas, plus kitchens and 1 or 2 bedrooms. Private houses with 1 to 3 bedrooms add washer/dryers and some also have sheds and garages. Backpacker's dorms have bunk beds, and shared kitchens and bathrooms.
properties.fees: 40$ unpowered site 2 adults45$ powered site 2 adults

properties.name: Edaggee Rest Area
properties.description: This is a Main Roads Western Australia 24 hour stopping rest area 43 km N of Wooramel Roadhouse or 81 km S of Carnarvon. It is a level gravel surfaced area that all vehicles can access. It has an eco-toilet, dump station, rubbish bin, and picnic areas. There is little shade or shelter from weather. It is a busy rest area. Maximum stay: 24 Hours

properties.name: Coalmine Beach Holiday Park
properties.description: Our guests stay close to nature as we are surrounded by five National Parks, and situated only metres away from the calm waters of the Nornalup Inlet. We offer a variety of accommodation to choose from including our luxury glamping tents, fully equipped en-suite chalets, cosy cabins with shared amenities or powered and unpowered sites.

properties.name: Bush Tucker Walk with Bundy
properties.description: Join your guide, Bundy, to learn about the seasons, bush medicine, local history, culture and traditions of the Bardi people. This is an easy paced 45-60 minute walk with plenty of stops in the shade and at key sites of bush medicine and dream time story sharing. Learn the importance of the Bardi Seasons and the significance of birds, marine and local ecosystems as you stroll the boardwalk and beachside taking in stunning views. Learn about the six seasons (lalin) whose time length varies.

properties.name: John Tognela Rest Areas
properties.description:
Those spacious and well-maintained overnight rest areas with good facilities are located off the highway (on both sides). 
This free roadside rest area offers toilets. It is accessible to motorbikes, RVs, camper trailers, caravans and big rigs.  This is not a 24hour camp ground.  Rest area only

properties.name: Cosy Corner (East) Free Campground
properties.description: Cosy Corner Dump Station. No Water.
properties.fees:
$15 per site/night (2 x adults and 2 x children)
Concession (Pensioner, Senior or Student) = $10

properties.name: Mount Hart Scenic Helicopter Flights
properties.description:
Explore Western Australia’s best kept secret from above and experience the Kimberley region like never before. Our Mount Hart Lodge Helicopter Tours offer a unique aerial perspective of the Kimberley region which allows you to explore pristine terrain, inaccessible by 4WD vehicles.

Our highly trained pilots are experts in navigating the rugged terrain of the outback. With a deep understanding of the region’s unique geography and natural wonders, let them guide you on an unforgettable journey to discover the Kimberley’s hidden gems and unique scenery. 

All our flights depart from Mount Hart, which is your base camp, and fly over some of the region’s most stunning landmarks and breathtaking landscapes.

properties.name: Yawuru Cultural Tour with Crocodile Feeding
properties.description: Experience a Yawuru Cultural Tour followed by a Crocodile Feeding Tour in the Kimberley region of Western Australia. Visit Minyirr Buru, a protected and sacred area for the Yawuru people, abundant in native flora and fauna whilst yarning with Johani about Yawuru culture, Country and history. Learn about Minyirr Buru's native flora, taste bird flower nectar and listen to Yawuru Dreamtime stories. Make sure you look out for the ancient dinosaur tracks in the coastal areas of the park.

properties.name: Whadjuk Biddi Kings Park
properties.description: Meet at the Giant Boab 'Gija Jumulu' tree in Kings Park where Olman will welcome you to his Country and share stories. Wander the gardens learning the history, hunting, cultural traditions and seasonality of the Noongar six seasons. Walk along the spectacular tree top walk taking in the views of Perth City, Swan River and beyond. Take a seat in the Beedawong man-made amphitheatre to enjoy the sounds of the Didgeridoo. View artefacts and learn of their uses in ancient and modern day living.

properties.name: Purnululu Two Night Luxury Experience
properties.description: This luxury twonight tour starts with an hours flight the Purnululu Explorer Scenic Flight, over Lake Argyle and the Osmond Ranges. Land at Purnululu National Park where our Gija guide will welcome you to Country. Over your 2 night stay, visit Echidna Chasm, Mini Palms, the Dome Walk and Cathedral Gorge. Enjoy two nights accommodation at the Bungle Bungles Wilderness Lodge before boarding your scenic flight back to Kununurra where you will soar over Argyle DIamond Mine.

properties.name: Purnululu Day Trek with Cathedral Gorge and Scenic Flight
properties.description: Start your day with a stunning one hour scenic flight to Purnululu National Park, flying over Lake Kununurra and the full expanse of Lake Argyle. View the Carr Boyd Ranges, Osmand Ranges, the Ord River and the Bow River before landing at the Bungle Bungle Range in Purnululu National Park for lunch and walks through spectacular Country with Traditional Custodians.This is one of the most striking geological landmarks and one of two World Heritage sites in Western Australia.

properties.name: Lake Ballard
properties.description:
ake Ballard, located in Western Australia’s Goldfields region, is renowned for its striking salt flats and the famous Gormley statues. Stretching over 10 square kilometers, this expansive lake transforms into a dazzling landscape during dry conditions, making it a popular destination for photographers and nature enthusiasts.

The lake is home to 51 life-sized bronze sculptures created by artist Antony Gormley, scattered across its surface. These artworks evoke a sense of connection to the land and are best appreciated at sunrise or sunset when the lighting enhances their presence. Visitors can enjoy walking on the salt crust, which can be both a unique experience and a great way to explore the area.

Wildlife flourishes around the lake, especially during the wetter months, attracting various bird species and providing excellent birdwatching opportunities. The surrounding landscape features stunning desert flora and is rich in Aboriginal history.

Accessible via a well-maintained road, Lake Ballard offers basic amenities and picnic areas for a comfortable visit. Whether you're an artist, photographer, or simply seeking tranquillity in nature, Lake Ballard promises a memorable experience amidst its breathtaking scenery.

properties.name: Kaya Cape Experience
properties.description: Learn about the deep connection the Wadandi people have to the Cape to Cape region. The accessible Kaya tour begins with a Welcome to Country. Wander sround the Cape Naturaliste Lighthouse, surrounded on three sides by oceans, as the landscape is interpreted through the eyes of an Indigenous Custodian. Gather at a private Meeting Place for an interactive experience with an artefact interpretation and didgeridoo session.

properties.name: Finding Yagan Perth Cultural Tour
properties.description: This walking tour features Perth's iconic laneways and traditional Dreamtime stories. Learn about the past and present history of the Nyungar people while taking in the sights of the Perth City streets. Gain an in-depth explanation of the Coolbaroo Club, the prohibited zone, and the Stolen Generation. Our final destination is Perth's Yagan Square precinct. Hear about the Square's design, unique artwork, and importance to our Aboriginal community.

properties.name: Bush Tucker and Wellbeing
properties.description:
In a relaxed setting of Maalinup Aboriginal Gallery in the Swan Valley you can taste a variety of wild bush foods, explore the bush food garden and feed the emus who are happy to pose for a photo opportunity.



Learn about the nutritional value and healing properties of various Australian native food and medicine plants from Dale. Sample unique wellbeing foods and herbs. Then try some bush tucker teas and snacks based on these foods.

properties.name: Cape Lodge Restaurant
properties.description: The Cape Lodge Restaurant in Margaret River has been voted in the Top Ten in the World for Food. The menu features seasonal local and homegrown produce plucked from nearby oceans, local farms, and the Cape Lodge kitchen garden. The wine list features current and back vintage wines from the great estates of Margaret River.

properties.name: Preston Beach Camp
properties.description:
Great free camp for 24 hours, clean toilets and showers.

Self contained vehicles only

properties.name: Munglinup Rest Area
properties.description: This is a rest area and park at Munglinup, There is a large dirt pullover from the highway, a small sealed car park opposite the roadhouse, and a level dirt area under the trees. These areas are suitable for all types of vehicles. This park has a toilet, playground, barbecue, picnic area, rubbish bins, water, and telephone. There are shady spots and open areas. There is some noise from the road but it is not visible from the highway.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Broome
properties.description:
Discovery Parks - Broome (formerly Roebuck Bay Caravan Park) is the only park in Broome located on a beach, with uninterrupted views over the turquoise waters of Roebuck Bay.

Witness the phenomenon "Staircase to the Moon" on your front caravan-step in Western Australia's spectacular getaway and final frontier: Broome. After waking up to the gentle crashing of waves on the shore, head for a cuppa at the Town Beach Cafe on site. 

When you're ready, lace up your boots and take on this adventure town. What to choose? Cruise through Horizontal Falls, watch a crocodile live feeding, or see dinosaur footsteps embedded in the rock. 

Are you more low key? Try out a few of the Aboriginal art galleries or meet the residents of the Broome Bird Observatory. 

Whether we're the beginning or the end of your caravanning journey, stay at Discovery Parks - Broome to visit this unforgettable Top End destination.

properties.name: Eighty Mile Beach Caravan Park
properties.description: Eighty Mile Beach Caravan Park is located on the beachfront between Port Hedland and Broome, and is an ideal stopover on this long stretch of road.

properties.name: Blue Dolphin Caravan Park and Holiday Village
properties.description: The Blue Dolphin Caravan Park is situated in the heart of Yeppoon. It is only a short stroll to the main beach, Yeppoon Lagoon, boutique shops and trendy cafes.

properties.name: Walpole West Rest Area
properties.description: This is a rest area 16 km W of Walpole or 104 km SE of Manjimup. It is a simple pullover from the highway with a blue P sign. There are no facilties. The surface is dirt/gravel. There is space for a number of vehicles but all must park in the pullover as there is bush surrounding the area. It is shady. It is loud from all the vehicles traveling on the road.

properties.name: Swan Valley Tourist Park
properties.description:
This tranquil, tree shaded caravan park offers fully equipped family apartments and ensuite cabins, along with pet friendly powered caravan sites, powered and unpowered camp sites. Only 18 km from Perth City and close to major shopping centres. The train to Perth and Fremantle leaves every 15 minutes from nearby Guildford. With a pool, tennis court and playground, the park offers something for everyone.

Just up the road from the Margaret River Chocolate Company and within walking distance from wineries, breweries, cafes and restaurants, the Swan Valley Tourist Park lies right in the heart of the Swan Valley and in close proximity to wonderful tourist attractions. Set in attractive grounds, the park offers full equipped family apartments, ensuite cabins, along with dog friendly powered and unpowered sites. Park facilities include a pool, recreation room with TV, pool table and tea/coffee making facilities, a barbecue area, a big playground, tennis court and fully equipped laundry.

properties.name: Tom Price Tourist Park
properties.description: Tom Price Tourist Park in WA is a green oasis in the tiny desert town of Tom Price at the base of the majestic Mount Nameless in the Pilbara region of WA.

properties.name: Forest Adventures High Ropes Course
properties.description:
Experience the Ludlow Tuart Forest from a whole new perspective on an adrenaline-fuelled high ropes adventure course in Western Australia. Set amongst the towering trees, six huge obstacle courses combine rope and wire challenges plus over 500 metres of flying foxes. The aerial adventure spans over eight acres of natural bushland and is a unique activity for all nature lovers and outdoor adventurers.

Each session lasts for approximately two hours and during this time you will be able to tackle at least two courses that vary in height and difficulty. Entry fees include all equipment hire and access to the aerial obstacles that will see you swinging through the trees like Tarzan, trying a 13m base jump or riding a BMX on a wire. Bring along a sense of adventure and challenge yourself to two hours of pure fun on this forest adventure.

Inclusions
- 2.5-hour exhilarating journey through the amazing forest as you take on suspended obstacles, Tarzan swings and breathtaking flying foxes
- All equipment hire and access to the courses for the entire duration of your visit
- Expect to complete two to three courses during your visit

Highlights
- In WA's beautiful South West environment, Forest Adventures combines ultimate fun in an incredible setting
- Combining world class European standards for safety and design with the South West's supreme environment
- Six huge courses combine rope and wire challenges to provide two hours of pure fun
- More than 500 metres of flying foxes
- Unicycle through the trees
- Tarzan ropes
- 13-metre base jump
- BMX on a wire
- Spider webs

properties.name: Lake Cave Guided Tour
properties.description:
Set amongst an enchanting Karri Forest, join the experts for a one hour guided tour of the Lake Cave in Margaret River. Descending through a sunken forest, visitors will go deep underground via a series of stairways and elevated boardwalks into this beautiful limestone cave to find a tranquil lake.

Lake Cave is the only cave on the Leeuwin-Naturaliste Ridge that has a permanent lake with delicate crystal formations mirrored in the still waters. Featuring over 300 small stairs and plenty of rests in between, the scenery is truly spectacular for those who make the journey to Lake Cave. Throughout the one hour tour, guides will activate the light show underground to see the cave transform into a colourful wonderland. Sit back and enjoy the silent ambience and mesmerising beauty created over millions of years.

properties.name: Truffle Experience with Truffle Hill
properties.description:
Truffle Hill was the first truffière to be established in Manjimup, Western Australia back in 1997. Dedication, devotion, and sheer hard work has seen Truffle Hill become one of the largest producers of black Périgord truffles in the world.

Truffle Hill is one of the few truffières in the world that allows a select number of people to participate in a truffle hunt in the winter months and see for themselves the fascination of how truffles grow, are hunted, and checked for maturity, and then harvested.

properties.name: Brewery Experience at Shelter Brewing
properties.description:
You asked, we delivered! Our brewery tours are up and running every day of the week! We're inviting you to get backstage and see the brewery from the inside, and enjoy some product along the way. 

First, we take you through the brewery and show you how the process works from grain to glass. Then we'll head upstairs for a tasting paddle, pint and lunch in the restaurant. 

Tours run every day of the week at 2, 3 and 4pm. They cost $65 and include the tour of the brewery, tasting paddle, pint, lunch and 10% off merch and takeaway beer.

properties.name: Cape Naturaliste Lighthouse Guided Tour
properties.description:
Discover the heritage precinct of Cape Naturaliste Lighthouse and climb the 59 stairs for breathtaking views of the Indian Ocean and Geographe Bay. Included in your admission to the lighthouse is a 30 minute guided tour where you'll hear the stories of hardship for the lighthouse keepers who lived on-site from 1903 to 1996.

The beautifully landscaped playgrounds, lawns and observation deck provide a beautiful backdrop to sit and admire the scenery before or after your tour of the Cape Naturaliste Lighthouse. Unearth the fascinating history behind this Western Australian landmark and gain a captivating insight into a working lighthouse. The Cape Naturaliste Lighthouse tour is a suitable activity for all ages and is open to the public daily between 9am and 5pm.

Inclusions
- Fully-guided tour of Cape Naturaliste Lighthouse
- Access to the Interpretive Centre

properties.name: Pemberton Beach and Forest Eco Adventure
properties.description:
"Discover the Yeagarup Dunes , the largest landlocked Sand Dunes in the Southern Hemisphere, seasonal coastal heath wildflowers, magnificent coastline and our secret magnificent old growth Karri Forest on this half day eco 4WD adventure into the Warren & D'Entrecasteaux National Parks near Pemberton. 

Highlights include;
Old growth Karri Forest (areas you may not be able to access yourself) Yeagarup Dunes - moving 4m per year into the forest and now 6km in from the beach Coastal Heath (Wildflowers in season) a totally different landscape Yeagarup Hut - an offroad accessible camping site and an occasional stop for lunch Yeagarup Beach - a stretch of beach from the Warren River to the Donnelly River only accessible by 4WD Warren River mouth - where the Warren River meets the ocean; opens and closes depending on the seasons

Pemberton Discovery Tours offers an extraordinary blend of nature exploration and comfortable wilderness accommodation in Western Australia. Nestled in the heart of the majestic Pemberton region, this eco-friendly experience allows adventurers to connect with the pristine beauty of the Australian bush. Pemberton Discovery Tours takes guests on immersive journeys through ancient forests, showcasing towering Karri trees, hidden waterfalls, and unique wildlife encounters. Knowledgeable guides provide insights into the region's rich ecology and history, ensuring an educational and unforgettable experience.

WA Wilderness Glamping complements these adventures with luxurious yet sustainable accommodations, offering safari-style tents equipped with all the comforts of home. This harmonious blend of adventure and relaxation lets guests unwind amid the untamed wilderness, all while minimizing their environmental footprint.

Pemberton Discovery Tours/WA Wilderness Glamping is the perfect choice for nature enthusiasts seeking an intimate, eco-conscious, and adventure-filled escape in one of Australia's most breathtaking natural settings."

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Rottnest Island
properties.description:
Nestled behind the dunes of the iconic Pinky Beach, one of the most relaxed and breathtaking coastal locations in Australia, Discovery Resorts - Rottnest Island is holiday accommodation with a difference. As the first low impact glamping experience on Rottnest Island, we value enrichment, connection and minimal impact.

Discovery Parks - Rottnest Island provides a variety of accommodation options, including modern cabins, glamping tents, and camping sites. The resort is situated in a central location on the island, making it easy to access Rottnest Island’s main attractions and natural beauty. The park offers a relaxed and comfortable environment, ideal for both short stays and extended vacations.

**Camping Facilities:**
The camping facilities at Discovery Parks - Rottnest Island cater to various preferences. The resort features a range of accommodation styles;well-equipped glamping tents to traditional camping sites. For those who enjoy a more comfortable camping experience, the glamping tents are stylish and come with quality furnishings and amenities. The traditional camping sites are spacious and well-maintained, with options for both powered and unpowered sites. Each site is designed to ensure comfort and privacy during your stay.

**Amenities:**
- Camp kitchen fully equipped with cooking facilities, BBQs, and a communal dining area for easy and enjoyable meal preparation.
- Modern bathroom facilities, including hot showers, that are clean and well-maintained.
- Laundry facilities available to keep your clothes fresh.
- Free WiFi provided throughout the park to stay connected while exploring the island.
- Small on-site shop for basic supplies and snacks.

**Family-Friendly Features:**
Discovery Parks - Rottnest Island is a family-friendly destination with features designed to keep children entertained. The resort has a large swimming pool, perfect for cooling off and having fun. The kids' playground is well-equipped to keep young guests entertained. Additionally, the resort's location provides easy access to the island's beaches, which are ideal for family-friendly activities such as swimming, snorkeling, and picnicking.

**Nearby Attractions:**
Discovery Parks - Rottnest Island is ideally located to explore the many attractions of Rottnest Island. The island is famous for its beautiful beaches and clear waters, making it a great destination for swimming, snorkeling, and diving. Rottnest Island is also known for its unique wildlife, including the quokkas, which can be seen around the island. Other attractions include bike rentals for exploring the island’s scenic paths, the historical Rottnest Island Lighthouse, and various walking trails that offer stunning views of the coastline.

**Pet Policy:**
Pets are not allowed at Discovery Parks - Rottnest Island.

**Check-In/Check-Out:**
Guests are welcome to check in from 2:00 PM, with check-out by 10:00 AM on the day of departure.

properties.name: Boogaloo Surf and Yoga Campsite
properties.description:
We are an eco friendly family run campsite just two kilometres from the Augusta town centre.

Bohemian Luxury Tents which include queen beds and linen, chill out area, lighting and and esky with refreshments.

Toilets and hot showers are available on site in a trendy converted sea container.

It is the perfect base for exploring the amazing south west coast line and less crowded surf spots.

properties.name: Kalbarri Anchorage Holiday Park
properties.description: Nestled on the banks of the Murchison River you are within walking distance to the foreshore and shops.

properties.name: Ngilgi Cave Ancient Lands Adventure Tour
properties.description:
Ngilgi Cave, located in Western Australia, is a captivating subterranean wonder that showcases the fascinating world of stalactites, stalagmites, and other limestone formations. This natural marvel offers an immersive underground experience, attracting visitors with its geological beauty and cultural significance. 

Ngilgi Cave holds a rich history among the local Wadandi people, known as the 'Nyoongar' culture, where it is associated with the mythological battle between a great serpent and a local hero.

Prepare to go back in time on this incredible journey down to the Ancient Ngilgi Cave, located in Yallingup, WA. As you descend a scenic pathway through the native bushland, stop at the interactive installations, learning about the cultural connections to the land, the Leeuwin Naturaliste Ridge and how it was formed, as well as the plethora of flora and fauna present in this remarkable place. 

As you enter the cave, prepare to be awestruck by the majestic stalagmites, helictites, and beautifully coloured shawls. The passionate guides stationed throughout will provide you with insights on these incredible formations that reside in this pristine cave.

Inclusions:
- Access to explore the Ancient Lands Experience
- Cave Entry

properties.name: Guided Jewel Cave Tour
properties.description:
The Jewel Cave, located in Margaret River is Western Australia's largest show cave beautifully preserved for over 3,000 years. Join a one hour fully guided tour of the Jewel Caves to experience a breathtaking visual display put on by Mother Nature. The Jewel Cave in Margaret River features three massive chambers with intricate ceiling decorations towering crystal creations and the largest straw stalactite found in any Australian tourist cave.

During a one hour guided tour of the Jewel Caves in Margaret River, you'll hear stories about the now extinct Tasmanian Tigers and see preserved remains on display in the Jewel Cave Centre. Guides will also point out beautiful examples of cave coral, stalagmites and striking formations such as "The Frozen Waterfall" and "Organ Pipes" that have formed over the years.

At the completion of the Jewel Caves tour, guests are invited to take a self-guided walk through the Karri Forest to view the towering trees above the cave's entrance. If you are wondering what is the best cave to visit in Margaret River, the Jewel Cave is an excellent place to start.

properties.name: Banksia Tourist Park
properties.description:
Welcome to the tranquil Banksia Tourist Park, located in a bush setting at the base of the Perth Hills. Offering superb onsite and site accommodation with pet friendly options in a relaxing atmosphere, surrounded by native flora and an abundance of bird-life.

Enjoy our amazing facilities including a café style camp kitchen, luxurious lounge and recreation room, undercover playground, grand pool, gazebo barbeques, doggy day care, dog walk areas and laundries.

Located in Hazelmere, at the base of the Gooseberry Hill National Park, just 20 minutes from Perth CBD, 15 minutes from the airport, the Swan and Bickley Valley wine regions and the Lesmurdie Falls. We are just a short drive to Midland Regional Centre and Kalamunda Village.

The Perth Hills is known for its stunning scenery, scenic drives, vibrant villages, wildflowers, national parks and offers some of the state’s best mountain biking and walk trails.

100km north of Perth

properties.name: Dunn Rocks Campsite 4WD Access ONLY
properties.description:
Dunn Rocks is a low, rocky headland flanked on each side by sweeping white beaches. There are no facilities

Beach driving
If you have a four-wheel-drive vehicle, you can drive right up to the water's edge at Dunns Rock. However be aware that these beaches are notoriously treacherous for vehicles and it is easy to become bogged in the most innocent looking wet or dry sand. Ask the ranger about surface conditions and tides.

Getting there
Dunn Rocks is a 45 minute drive east of Esperance, mostly by sealed road. The last 14km south along Dunn Rock Rd is unsealed, suitable for four-wheel-drive only.

properties.name: National Anzac Centre
properties.description:
Want to learn more about Australia's war history? Spend the day at Western Australia's award winning National Anzac Centre and hear the stories as told by the ANZAC's that served for Australia. This museum focuses on the human connection to war with interactive multimedia, technology and historical artefacts paying tribute to those that went to war. 

The museum is located in the Albert Port which was the departure point for thousands of men and women who farewelled Australia and headed off to war. The location overlooks the King George Sound and is also on the grounds of the Princess Royal Fortress. 

With entry to this museum, you are free to wander the grounds viewing all the exhibits and explore the barracks and gun defences of the Princess Royal Fortress.

The interactive museum is developed by the Western Australia Museum and the Australian War Memorial through interactive displays that share the personal stories of the ANZAC's.

properties.name: Burns Beach Sunset Village

Visit near/local points of interest, use us as a base for other activities, or simply relax in a cabin/on your site.
We are situated on a beach front location 30km from Perth city, north on the Mitchell Freeway; take the Burns Beach Road exit to the left & follow your nose towards the coast to 35 Ocean Parade ILUKA.

We are 55 metres from the high water mark on the Indian Ocean, within the Marmion Marine Park, with ocean views including that of Rottnest Island, visible on good days to the West-South-West – you’ll feel ‘away from it all’

We provide on site holiday/tourist cabins, powered sites for caravans, RVs, camper trailers & other recreational overnight/short stay sites.
Amenities in & around the Park include: full ablution block (separate male/female facilities) & laundry, barbecue areas, front-door bus service & large public park immediately opposite.
The popular Burns Beach Restaurant & Café is right on site with daily breakfasts, lunches & dinner (Fri & Sat nights), with North Westerly ocean aspects.

Use the beach/ocean front for water related activities; walk/cycle the ocean front path; indulge in major department store shopping at Lakeside Joondalup.

Shopping centres/cinema complexes are less than 10 minutes away; various other points of interest (eg Mindarie Marina, Barbagallo’s Raceway,

Botanical Golf, the Maze at Whiteman Park) are within 20-30 minutes drive.

Enjoy the ocean views from the Cafe with great coffee; watch spectacular sunsets; or simply enjoy the ambience of your location.

Almost all coastal access routes require a 4WD. While the Homestead can be accessed by 2WD vehicles under favourable road conditions (not wet), proper tire deflation on sandy tracks is crucial. Maintain a speed of under 40kph to protect wildlife and tracks.

properties.name: Busselton Whale Watching Cruise
properties.description:
Set sail on a luxurious vessel into the pristine waters of Geographe Bay to witness the annual whale migration on this two hour whale watching cruise from Busselton. Prepare to be mesmerised as you head out to sea to watch these gentle giants frolicking in the ocean. From September to December each year, majestic Humpback Whales and their calves can be found resting in Geographe Bay before making their long journey back to the Arctic waters after breeding in the warmer waters up north.

Watch in awe as these creatures throw tail slaps, spy hop, breach and many more incredible whale behaviours on the day. If you’re lucky, you may even witness Southern Right Whales and Blue Whales throughout the whale watching cruise. Cruising aboard a new 17 metre vessel, wildlife lovers will be treated to panoramic views of this natural phenomenon from multiple viewing decks. Choose from a morning or afternoon whale watching cruise to live out this real life David Attenborough moment.

Highlights: 

- Two hour whale watching cruise from Busselton
- Witness these amazing creatures play about in Geographe Bay
- Includes free entry into Busselton Jetty
- Opportunity to spot Southern Right and Blue Whales
- Free Picture CD per booking of Whale pictures from previous tours
- 20% discount offer at local restaurants

Meekatharra Accommodation Centre provides quality workforce accommodation to contractors and miners for long or short term stays. It also offers accommodation for tourists travelling through the Goldfields.

Our onsite commercial kitchen provides workforce meal packages to the highest standard. Including, hot breakfast, crib lunch and buffet dinners.

Meekatharra Accommodation Centre is able to call on Mobile Accommodation Camps and it's substantial fleet of KingVans depending on the size & needs of your workforce. 

It is also the local Caltex Service Station and serves delicious sit down and takeaway meals.  Our famous Golden Fried Chicken is a special treat, as is the Meekatharra Candy Store.

We are also the Meekatharra caravan park, and welcome all tourists, backpackers and campers.  We have some grassy areas for campers, and spotless amenities and guest laundry.

LAKE INDOON IS CURRENTLY CLOSED UNTIL 30 JUNE 2024, WITH EXPECTED RE-OPENING DATE OF MONDAY 1 JULY 2024

Free camping area around Lake Indoon run by the Carnamah Shire Council, with toilets, showers and clean drinking water. Year- long fire ban in effect, but gas BBQ is available for use, as well as picnic tables.
