properties.name: Dales Gorge Campground
properties.description: Near Dales Geroge campground you'll find massive mountains, clear rockpools, waterfalls and gorges. Swimming is welcomed in the Fortescue Falls and Circular Pool. Camping is suitable for tents, trailers, and caravans. Facilities include bush toilets, picnic tables and BBQ. Drinking water is not availalbe.

properties.name: Bettys Beach Camp Area
properties.description:
This campsite offers stunning views, welcoming hosts, and is pet-friendly, making it an excellent destination. Facilities include toilets, caravan spaces, and camper trailer options. 

With a boat ramp nearby, as well as opportunities for fishing and swimming, it’s an ideal location for a relaxing stay. Basic amenities like drop toilets and bins are provided, but be sure to arrive early to secure your spot. 

The 5km access road can get muddy when it rains, but it’s worth the visit for the amazing surroundings!

This area is used as a fishing spot and is Closed 15 Feb- 30 Apr for salmon season. There are some fishing shacks and homes here. 

There is a public toilet and rubbish bin here. 

The area is secluded and beautiful but there is a lot of fishing activity so it is not so quiet. Maximum stay: 48 Hours.

properties.name: Quobba Blowholes Campground
properties.description:
Campers are advised that; the maximum length of stay for overnight campers/caravans at the Blowholes Campgrounds is thirty (30) days during peak season which runs from the 1st of April to the 1st of October. 
Fees may be paid online via our website, www.carnarvon.org.au

**please be advised there is no free camping at Quobba Station

properties.name: Cocklebiddy Roadhouse and Camping
properties.description:
Cocklebiddy Roadhouse offers travelers fuel, a selection of takeaway foods, a licensed restaurant, and a bar with a pool table. The Cocklebiddy Wedgetail Inn provides 24 motel accommodation units and a caravan park with 15 powered sites and 10 unpowered sites. 

No bookings are taken for the caravan park—sites are allocated on a first-come, first-served basis.

properties.name: Four Seasons Holiday Park
properties.description:
Four Seasons Holiday Park is one of the largest Busselton Accommodation locations and is set on 22 acres of land among the shade of old peppermint trees, with large, open-grassed areas - an extremely peaceful setting for getting away from it all. 

The relaxing, tranquil atmosphere has been described by many as a country hideaway in a beachside setting. Even your best friend is welcome! 

Located only 200 metres from the serene shores of Geographe Bay, Four Seasons Holiday Park is the perfect base from which to explore the entire region.

properties.name: Ongerup Caravan Park & Accommodation
properties.description: Ongerup Caravan Park is centrally located between Perth and Esperance and between Kalgoorlie and Albany in WA’s Great Southern region. Ongerup is a small farming-based community that is nestled between the Stirling Range & Fitzgerald River National Parks and the home of the Yongergnow Mallee fowl Centre. Ongerup Caravan Park is the perfect spot for a relaxing stopover.

properties.name: Merredin Tourist Park
properties.description:
Merredin Tourist Park is located on the Great Eastern Highway to the east of the town centre, which is 260km east of Perth.  The Park offers everything from caravan and camping to luxury fully equipped chalets and villas.
We are a pet-friendly park, but regrettably no pets are allowed inside our on-site accommodation.

Our Park offers a swimming pool and barbeque facilities. It is within close proximity to the centre of town which offers all amenities including supermarkets, bowling club, gym, hospital, post office, chemist, banks, restaurants, shops and more.

At Merredin Tourist Park we have level shady sites for caravans and camping, with some drive through sites as well. Two well maintained ablution blocks are at our visitors’ disposal.

We are a pet-friendly park but unfortunately cannot allow any pets inside our on-site accommodation options.

properties.name: Billabong Roadhouse
properties.description: Popular free overnight parking at Billabong Roadhouse. Free hot showers. Reasonably priced meals and healthy options at the Roadhouse. 20$ deposit for keys at the Roadhouse front counter

properties.name: Orleans Bay Caravan Park
properties.description: Orleans Bay Caravan Park

properties.name: Big Valley Campsite
properties.description: Big Valley Campsite is nestled amongst the hills of our family owned working sheep farm, ten minutes South East of Margaret River.

properties.name: Hidden Valley Tourist Park
properties.description: Located only minutes from the centre of Kununurra, Hidden Valley Tourist Park provides large shaded grassed sites for vans and tents as well as cabins.
properties.fees: $16 per person unpowered camping $42 for 1 or 2 people on a powered site $140 for a cabin

properties.name: Geraldton Caravan Park
properties.description:
We are fully pet friendly! Sit among the shady gums and enjoy the many species of bird life that call this park home. Take a refreshing plunge in the sparkling in-ground pool. Then finish the day off with an easy meal in the BBQ area.

Only 10km from the Geraldton City Centre, the Geraldton Caravan Park is the perfect place to call 'home' when exploring the City of Greater Geraldton and surrounding areas. Located in a rural setting 10kms north of the CBD, the park offers a quiet retreat to unwind after a day's travel. Dogs are welcome and with such reasonable rates, there's an accommodation style to suit every budget. With Resident Managers and friendly staff, there is always someone on hand to guide you through the many natural wonders of Australia's Coral Coast. Geraldton Caravan Park provides a variety of accommodation, each with a range of features depending on your preferences and budget. Our parks features different kinds of accommodation such as Cabin, Cottage, and En suite Van. Each one has its own set of feature, room, and price range. We also offers plenty of sites include powered sites, powered drive thru site and unpowered site. Our sites can fits from tent, one car space, caravan, motorhome to coach bus.​Our park is set in a middle of beautiful Australian outback. We are pet friendly park where you can bring your family member with you. Great for visiting family in Geraldton, wild flower exploring and a quiet relaxing holiday away from busy lifestyle. Solar heated swimming pool, big back yard and dog unleash training area can make you happy. It's only take 3km to beach and 10 mins to town.

properties.name: Mary Pool Rest Area
properties.description: This large rest area with good facilities and a dump point, is located well off the highway, on the bank of the river. There is a limited shade. Drive slowly on the bridge, due to its bad condition! 24hrs maximum stay. Old bridge is now closed and a new sealed road into camp area about 1.5 km west

properties.name: Whalebone Bay Campground
properties.description:
Whalebone Bay camping area offers 4 sites near the beach. Sites are suitable for vehicle based camping, caravans and camper trailers. 

There are no facilities available. 

There is a maximum stay of 24 hours. You will need to bring your own water. A camping permit is required.

properties.name: Hopetoun Caravan Park
properties.description: Located along the beach of Mary Ann Haven

properties.name: Acclaim Pine Grove Holiday Park
properties.description: Welcome to Pine Grove Holiday Park, Esperance

properties.name: Big Lagoon Campground
properties.description: The Big Lagoon camping area has well spaced camp sites and sheltered decking, toilets and barbecue facilities near the shoreline.

properties.name: Eneabba Recreation Centre Campground
properties.description: Campground with unpowered sites. Hot showers and clean toilets are available. There are some trees for shade and there's no noise pollution from the road.

properties.name: Willie Creek Camping Area
properties.description: This scenic camping area with no facilities is located by the beach and offers Ocean views. There is a fishing spot and 4WD is recommended. The maximum stay is 72hrs. Watch out for crocs!

properties.name: Linga Longa Farm Stay at Lynton Station
properties.description:
Linga Longa Farm Stay at Lynton Station provides powered and unpowered sites, suitable for all camping vehicles. There is also a bunkhouse and self-contained cottage available. Facilities include a small camp kitchen, BBQ, hot showers, and toilets. Telstra mobile phone coverage only. Activities include fishing, swimming, and walking tracks. 
No Eftpos card payments

properties.name: Neds Campground
properties.description: Featuring 18 camps sites, Neds campground is alongside a sandy beach and nestled behind the sand dunes. Suitable for tents, caravns and camper trailers (no longer than 7.5m x 4.5m). Facilities include toilets, and a ranger station.  Camp fires are not permitted. You will need to bring your own water.

properties.name: Glen Mervyn Dam
properties.description: Glen Mervyn Dam provides a day rest area on its western bank, as well as an overnight campground with amenities on the eastern side of the Dam. There is a narrow unsealed track leading into this site, which is why caravans might find it difficult to access it. This is a popular water sports destination with good swimming and fishing (when the water level is high). There is a complete fire ban (incl. gas stoves).

properties.name: Barradale Rest Area Yannarie River
properties.description: This is a Main Roads Western Australia rest area 156 km NE of Minilya Roadhouse or 70 km SW of Nanutarra Roadhouse. It is a large flat dirt area with some grassy patches and some trees. There is no shade or shelter. There is an eco-toilet, dump station, rubbish bins, picnic tables, and fire pits. It is near the highway and loud. All types of vehicles can access this area. Maximum stay: 24 Hours

properties.name: Wagoe Chalets
properties.description: Wagoe Beach is situated on the door step of Wagoe Farm.
properties.fees:

properties.name: Kimberleyland Waterfront Holiday Park
properties.description: A stay at Kimberleyland puts you front and centre to spectacular scenery.

properties.name: Busselton Jetty Tourist Park
properties.description: The Park offers high quality, affordable caravan and camping sites as well as a range of cabins, campers kitchens and facilities.
properties.fees: Powered site (2 adults) $38.5 low season and $48 peak season for 2 ppl. Single rate $30 low and $38.5 peak season. Extra adult $13.

properties.name: Wave Rock Caravan Park
properties.description: Campground right next to Wave Rock  / Hyden Rock.
properties.fees: 25$ unpowered site / 30$ powered site per person.  $3 for a shower for non campers.

properties.name: The Loop Walk Karbarri National Park
properties.description:
Murchison Gorge Loop Walk

Discover the impressive erosive forces of the Murchison River on this stunning yet challenging hike through dramatic gorges.

This 8 km Class 4 hike offers breathtaking views from the cliff's edge, descends to the riverbank where you can explore sandy beaches, river gums, and potential swimming spots, and then loops back up to Nature's Window. Essential gear includes 3-4 liters of water per person per day, a hat, loose clothing, and sturdy footwear, as there is no drinking water and limited shade along the trail.

Essential Information:
- Distance: 8 km
- Difficulty: Class 4 hike. The trail features rough paths with minimal -modifications. Requires a moderate to high level of fitness and self-sufficiency due to infrequent encounters with others. Weather conditions can impact safety, so carry extra water.
- Gradient: Includes steep and uneven sections.
- Experience: Bushwalking experience is advised.
- Duration: Allow 3-4 hours.

Best Time to Visit:
May to October: Cooler weather is ideal. Avoid hiking in hot conditions. Note that from November to March, the trail is closed after 7 am due to heat.

Access:
Begin at the Nature’s Window Carpark.

properties.name: Tulki Campground
properties.description: Tulki is the closest campground to the beautiful Turquoise Bay and is situated near the mouth of a dry creek system. All sites are approximately 200 metres from the beach and offer a raw camping experience. Tulki is located adjacent to separate zones of the the Ningaloo Marine Park.

properties.name: Parry Beach
properties.description: Parry Beach offers Shire run camping with toilets, solar powered showers, and BBQs. Caretakers are on site. NO large vehicles are permitted.

properties.name: Fowlers Camp
properties.description: Fowlers Camp provides basic coastal bush camping. There are no facilities available. You will need to be self-sufficient. Bookings can be made at the visitor information centre.

properties.name: Wundowie Campground RV Park
properties.description: Free overnight camp. Well maintained, basic, setup for RV and self contained vehicles only

properties.name: Voyager Estate
properties.description:
Voyager Estate is a small, second-generation, family-owned estate. All our wines are 100% estate grown, made and bottled, and reflect the unique qualities of our place in Stevens Valley with its undulating slopes, warm summers and cooling maritime breezes. 

We are one of Australia's most innovative producers of world-class Chardonnay and Cabernet Sauvignon and by 2023 we'll be Certified Organic. 

Our aim is to shine a light on what makes our unique place in Margaret River so special. Both through how we grow and make our wine, and how we share the experience of it with every visitor that walks through our door. 

Visit for a seated tasting, immerse yourself in one of our wine experiences, and book a table for a wine-paired long lunch.

properties.name: Beacon Caravan Park
properties.description:
Beacon Caravan Park is a holiday park featuring a heated indoor pool and spa, basketball courts, tennis courts, bike hire, DVD hire and WiFi.

The park provides both powered and un-powered sites. There is a modern ablution block which includes a disabled toilet and shower and laundry on premises as well as a campers kitchen, alongside a grassed area. Kitchen has cooking facilities & BBQ. Gazebo is in a bush setting area. No charge for BBQ or dryer. Dog friendly park, all pets must be on a leash. No RAC rating. EFTPOS available.

All units are self contained with reverse cycle air conditioners.

properties.name: Jabez Farm Moora
properties.description: Large variety of private, separate camp sites. Powered, unpowered, 2wd , 4wd bush camping for self contained vehicles.

properties.name: Port Smith Lagoon and Caravan Park
properties.description:
Approximately 160 km south of Broome on the Great Northern Highway, a well signposted turn-off takes you down 23 km of well maintained, all weather dirt road to one of the Kimberley region's best kept secrets, Port Smith Lagoon and Caravan Park.

The park is known Australia wide for its friendly service and happy atmosphere. Listen to the songs of the large array of bird life and spot the resident mopokes or frill necked lizards amongst the shade trees.

properties.name: Brookton Caravan Park
properties.description: Very clean and simple campsite, close to the road but not noisy, at the entrance to brookton and right next to the city's sports fields.

properties.name: Molloy Hideaway Holiday Park
properties.description: Situated about 15kms north-east of Augusta and within the Margaret River Wine Region, Molloy Caravan Park can offer you a relaxed holiday that includes boating, water skiing, canoeing and fishing. A tranquil bushland setting on the banks of the Blackwood River (Not on Molloy Island) with excellent modern facilities.

properties.name: Leschenault Inlet Caravan Park
properties.description: On-site vans and cabins are situated on the shady sites at the Leschenault Inlet Caravan Park.

properties.name: 3 Mile Camp Gnaraloo Station
properties.description: Basic camp site with lovely, rugged ocean views.

properties.name: Tjukayirla Roadhouse
properties.description:
The Tjukayirla Roadhouse is located deep within the Great Victoria Desert on the Great Central Road.
We are extremely pleased to offer travellers to this unique part of Australia a wide range of products and services.

properties.name: Southern Stars Holiday Park
properties.description: We are a family owned caravan park offering a relaxed and open environment. We are dog friendly and would love to welcome your well behaved furry companion into our park.

properties.name: Busselton Lazy Days Caravan Park
properties.description: Lazy Days Caravan Park is the perfect family getaway conveniently located on Bussell Highway in the heart of Busselton.

properties.name: Gateway Caravan Park Norseman
properties.description:
Norseman is your gateway to Western Australia travelling from the east.  Steeped in history from mining days gone by, Norseman has an abundance of interesting attractions for exploring, bush walking and photography.  

Acclaim Parks' Gateway Caravan Park is located in Norseman, offering guests large powered and drive-thru sites, clean and modern ensuite chalets as well as budget cabins.

properties.name: Mount Magnet Caravan Park
properties.description: The Mount Magnet Caravan Park is conveniently located on the north side of the heritage listed Shire Office, as Great Northern Highway becomes Hepburn Street through town. Situated in close proximity to shops, post office, Wirnda Barna Art Centre, cafe, hotels, Outdoor Picture Theatre and Parks, the Caravan Park offers friendly service, clean and tidy facilities and pleasant garden surrounds. Please follow the signs to the Caravan Park office where you will be greeted and shown to your site. For travellers' convenience, an effluent dump point is also located at the Mount Magnet Caravan Park. The laundry includes coin-operated washing machines and dryers. Gas bottles and water tanks can also be filled here for a fee. The popular Campers' Kitchen, with full kitchen facilities and electric BBQ' is located in a pleasant outdoor setting.

properties.name: Leonora Caravan Park
properties.description:
Leonora Caravan Park is a small, friendly oasis right in the centre of town. The Park is a popular base for prospectors who come back year after year looking for gold and sharing their stories around a camp fire at the end of a day. 

It is also an ideal base for exploring the famous Golden Quest Discovery Trail and Leonora Loop Trails.

They offer comfortable facilities and a warm welcome to all their guests. So, whether you are a traveller exploring one of the many self-drive trails or a worker looking for affordable accommodation, they have got you covered at Leonora Caravan Park.

properties.name: Birdwood Downs
properties.description:
You are welcome to stay on our quiet bush style campground amongst a grove of shady trees. We offer sites with ample space for tents, camper trailers, campervans and caravans. You will have the experience of a bush camp combined with the comfort of shared facilities with a hot shower.
Our campground has excellent drinking water. You can use our well equipped camp kitchen.
All sites are unpowered.
To ensure the quiet nature of the place we do not allow generators and pets.

properties.name: Honeymoon Bay WA
properties.description: Come anytime! We have grassy, beachfront, and ocean. Bookings only essential for the Beach Shack, Bob'n'Barrys, and Gang Shack covered areas. Picnic/Day visits $10/vehicle Enjoy local guided tours to surrounding beaches and rock art sites, and even try your hand at crabbing traditional-style after making your very own spear! Public telephone, essential Wi-Fi, and hot showers available. All vehicles welcome. Airport pick-ups from Kalumburu Community available during wet season.

properties.name: Wyndham Caravan Park
properties.description: Nestled beneath the mighty Bastion Range, with 7 acres of lawns & huge shady ghost gums, we offer a relaxing environment from which to explore the Kimberley.
properties.fees: Powered Sites 2X Adults    $38/nightPowered Site   1XAdult       $30/night       Unpowered Sites  $15.00/Adult  $5.00/Child

properties.name: Kojonup Caravan Park
properties.description: Whether you just need somewhere to stay overnight, for a few days while you tour Kojonup and surrounding areas, a week to relax or you need somewhere to stay while you are working in the area

properties.name: Quinninup Eco Park
properties.description:
PLEASE NOTE: This park is only reachable by phone as they do not have internet access. Quinninup Tourist and Caravan Park is set amongst the tall trees of the South West of Western Australia. It has large drive through grassed caravan and campsites, nine metre roads (no backing up), five star toilet block with disabled and baby facilities. We are pet friendly and welcome large groups and also large Rigs. We have great drinking water and a dump site. There is a great camp kitchen, now with a pizza oven! 

There are 6 self contained family sized chalets with 2 bedrooms, sleeping up to six people, with all linen, towels etc. provided. They are self contained and have a verandah where you can sit and view Kangaroos grazing on the lawns.

properties.name: Boddington Caravan Park
properties.description:
Nestled along the banks of the Hotham River, the Boddington Caravan Park is the perfect spot to park your caravan, pitch your tent, or enjoy a unique stay at the Old Boddington Police station.

Conveniently located just a short walk away from the information centre, state-of-the-art Hotham Park, public swimming pool, nature trails, local cafes, petrol stations and IGA, the Boddington Caravan Park has everything you need for a relaxing getaway.

properties.name: Gambanan Wilderness Retreat
properties.description: Escape to the best kept secret of the Dampier Peninsula, a location of unparalleled beauty and home of The Davey Family, where their traditions and family are forever an integral part. Gumbanan Bush Camp is located just before One Arm Point Community (the Ardiyooloon Community). It is a short 1.5km drive off the main road at the turnoff.
properties.fees: Camp Fee: $15/person Under 10 years FreeFamily Pass $40(2 adult 3 children)

properties.name: Barn Hill Beach Side Station Stay
properties.description:
Our rustic style accommodation is designed to complement the surroundings of our nature based park and we have variable options to suit your needs.

POWERED SITES
In shaded and lawned grounds 80 metres from the beach, with capacity to fit large vans and trailered boats. Power is 24 hour.

UNPOWERED SITES
With breathtaking views of the ocean, our unpowered sites accommodate the more self-sufficient traveller. Fresh potable water is provided and they are within walking distance from the shop and ablution block.
properties.fees: Powered sites are $35 per night and $28 per night for unpowered for 2 adults $8 per child 5 and over

properties.name: Ocean View Caravan Park
properties.description: Situated on Second Avenue in the coastal town of Onslow - the Caravan Park is located on the beach front.

properties.name: Maranup Ford Caravan Park
properties.description:
Centrally located in the Blackwood River Valley, in the South West of Western Australia. Maranup Ford has easy road access and is just minutes away from the historic mining town of Greenbushes, beautiful Bridgetown, Balingup, Boyup Brook and Nannup with all their amazing scenery and attractions.

Campers can choose from a range of powered or unpowered camping sites in either morning or evening shade areas. We even have some under shelters for those traveling in inclement weather

Caravans, you will find shady grass or hardstand powered sites. 15amp electrical outlets mean that you can run aircon or heating. All have water available.

Camper trailers and smaller vans also have access to the special tucked away sites on the side which have 10amp power and no water connectors.

Campers can choose from a range of powered or unpowered camping sites in either morning or evening shade areas. We even have some under shelters for those traveling in inclement weather.

Check In for caravans & camping – 12 noon onwards. Check Out is 10.00am

Our park is designed for each van to have plenty of space around it and, by planting trees and shrubs within the park area, you also have some privacy. Visitors in the park are welcome to enjoy the gardens and use the mobile booster coverage on the homestead lawns. Groups are most welcome.

properties.name: Little Bay Campsite
properties.description:
Little Bay Campsite, Horrocks. One hour North of Geraldton WA. Access: 4WD only (but there is a caravan park in town).

4wd access only

Drop Down Toilets. No running water or electricity, stay for the day or come prepared.

Great fishing spots, snorkelling, bring a boogie board for the massive sand dunes, golf course in town, and of course, surf.
properties.fees: $15 per car, per night for a maximum of 5 nights

properties.name: Western Flora Caravan and Nature Park
properties.description: Our 160 acre park is set in the North Eneabba sandplains, famous for the spectacular range of flowering plants, especially in season. It is also a birdwatchers delight and native animals are regular visitors. There are also 13kms of walking tracks in natural bushland. Fuel and shop onsite. August/September/October. Bookings essential. All vehicles.

properties.name: Karratha Caravan Park
properties.description:
Located on the edge of Karratha,  Karratha Caravan Park provides a range of accommodation options at affordable prices. 

Whether you have your own caravan, require a campsite or are simply traveling around the country,  Karratha Caravan Park has your accommodation needs covered, and at competitive prices.

We are a friendly Karrataha caravan park that welcomes tourists and provides affordable accommodation options in the Pilbara region.  Karratha Caravan Park is pet friendly, so your furry friends are welcome.

properties.name: Kimberley Entrance Caravan Park
properties.description: Kimberley Entrance is a beautiful and spacious caravan park. Situated in the centre of Derby in the Kimberley region on the north west coast of Australia. Our Derby caravan park offers a huge selection of spacious and shady powered and unpowered sites to suit everyone on a Kimberley camping trip.

properties.name: Golden Ponds
properties.description:
Set on 100-acres of picturesque lakes and landscaped gardens with great fishing facilities. Various accommodation types from apartments, cottages and budget units to caravan & camping.  Clean facilities & amenities. Onsite general store.  
BBQ area & childrens playgrounds.
Lunch time cafe & fine dining with in-house bar. Secured complex with general access between 8am-5pm
Two resident ponies, peahen & chicks; ducks and more create a friendly and relaxing atmosphere.
properties.fees: Powered caravan site @ $40 per night or $235 per week. For two adults.

properties.name: SBend Caravan Park
properties.description: S-Bend Caravan Park and Roadhouse offers affordable accommodation

properties.name: Bremer Bay Caravan Park
properties.description: Situated on the south coast of Western Australia, Bremer Bay is a small fishing and holiday resort.
properties.fees: Sites cost from $33/ $37/ $44 per night, depending on the season. Seniors/Pensioners will enjoy a $30 flat rate per night during low and off peak periods with every 4th night free. No further discounts apply.

properties.name: Warmun Roadhouse
properties.description: Warmun Roadhouse
properties.fees: Caravan Site Powered $35; Caravan Site Unpowered $30; Camping Site (1-2 people) $15; Extra person $5

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Carnarvon
properties.description:
On Western Australia’s stunning Coral Coast, some 900km north of Perth, Discovery Parks – Carnarvon (formerly Wintersun Caravan and Tourist Park) is very much at the heart of a tropical oasis that offers everything you need for a great Australian holiday.

Blessed with a range of accommodation options to suit all types of travellers, numerous cabins come with their own outdoor seating area, shaded by the park's ample foliage.

Onsite Vans are ideal for budget conscious travellers, some with their own ensuite bathroom, while spacious powered sites are close to all of the park's excellent amenities.

Selected sites and cabins do allow pets, there is an off-leash dog park and on-site facilities include a generous swimming pool, adventure playground, camp kitchen and BBQ areas

properties.name: Paraburdoo Caravan Park
properties.description: The Paraburdoo Caravan Park provides 10 caravan bays for tourists. Contact the Rocklea Palms hotel on 9189 5018 for bookings. There is accommodation available at the local hotel, and P&O Catering facilities. IGA operates a modern supermarket from within the shopping centre in Paraburdoo where there is a pharmacy, newsagency, bakery and cafe.

properties.name: Dwellingup Chalets & Caravan Park
properties.description: The Dwellingup Chalet and Caravan Park is one of Australias most unique developments set in the heart of Dwellingup state forest.

properties.name: Blackrock Tourist Park
properties.description: Offering first class facilities within the Port Hedland region, Blackrock Tourist Park caters to all travelers. With all accommodation options available, friendly staff and pool to unwind in, your stay in Port Hedland is sure to be comfortable and relaxing.

properties.name: Acclaim Rose Gardens Beachside Holiday Park
properties.description: Acclaim Rose Gardens Beachside Holiday Park

properties.name: Waterloo Village Caravan Park
properties.description:
Waterloo Village Caravan Park is located in Picton in the Dardanup Council.

Used primarily for elder and permeant residents, it does have 10 sites available for casual campers.

properties.name: Advent Park Campground
properties.description: Advent Park is 10 hectares of well shaded park offering powered and unpowered sites to campers and caravaners.

properties.name: Sandy Point Camp
properties.description:
Sandy Point Camp is located in Dirk Hartog Island National Park, making it the perfect destination for a snorkelling and diving holiday.

Visitors can enjoy the beautiful coral of the Shark Bay Marine Park, as well as a number of reef fish including coral trout, blue-lined emperor and scribbled angelfish.

Sandy Point Camp itself is one of six designated campgrounds in the area. Sandy Point Camp is located well away from the water's edge and is more suitable for a short overnight stay before heading north or south on the island.

Accessible only by four-wheel drive (4WD), it has no facilities and is essentially a wilderness camping experience, so please look after the island while camping and it will still be in good condition the next time you visit.

Fires or firewood collection are not permitted. For cooking, use a portable gas appliance. Campfires are not permitted.

Please take out what you bring in. Do not leave any rubbish, food scraps or any other items in the national park and do not bury any rubbish. Stow rubbish securely to prevent it from being blown away.

Campers are advised to bring enough drinking water for the duration of their stay.

properties.name: Homestead Campground
properties.description: Homestead Camp is located in the stunning Avon Valley National Park. Close to jarrah, marri and powderbark forest, the valleys themselves are forested with wandoo, making for peaceful bushwalks through the area.

properties.name: Drummonds Campground
properties.description: Drummonds Camp is located in the stunning Avon Valley National Park. Close to jarrah, marri and powderbark forest, the valleys themselves are forested with wandoo, making for peaceful bushwalks through the area.

properties.name: Dampiers Landing - Sammys Well Camp
properties.description:
ampiers Landing / Sammys Well Campground is located in Dirk Hartog Island National Park, making it the perfect destination for a snorkelling and diving holiday.

It is at the north-east of the island, approximately a three-hour drive from the barge transfer drop-off. A single site that can accommodate a maximum of three vehicles, but is not recommended for trailers. There are no facilities.

William Dampier came ashore here in August 1699, describing the vegetation and making the first scientific collection of Australian plants. He also named Shark Bay and 300 years later, a plaque was erected at this site in his honour.

Visitors can enjoy the beautiful coral of the Shark Bay Marine Park, as well as a number of reef fish including coral trout, blue-lined emperor and scribbled angelfish.

The campground is one of six designated campgrounds in the area.

Accessible only by four-wheel drive (4WD), it has no facilities and is essentially a wilderness camping experience, so please look after the island while camping and it will still be in good condition the next time you visit.

Campfires are not permitted.

Campers are advised to bring enough drinking water for the duration of their stay.

properties.name: Yarragil Campground
properties.description: Lane Poole Reserve covers some 55,000 hectares of Jarrah forest just 100 kilometres from Perth near Dwellingup. The Murray River flows through the reserve and offers numerous recreational activities from swimming and canoeing to white-water rafting. Yarragil is the smallest campground situated along the Murray River

properties.name: Yardie Creek Campground
properties.description:
Yardie Creek is located at the southern end of the park near the popular day use area and Yardie Creek Boat Cruise. 

All sites are located approximately 80 metres from the beach. Yardie Creek has a wide sandy beach stretching to the North. 

Small boats can be launched from the Yardie Creek mouth over very soft sand.

properties.name: Wooleen Station
properties.description: Wooleen Station is a working cattle station in the outback of Western Australia dedicated to landscape regeneration and conservation. Your hosts, the Pollock family, will make your stay comfortable, educational and enjoyable in the National Trust listed homestead or the self-contained rammed earth guest houses.

properties.name: Wharncliffe Mill Bush Retreat and Eco Tours
properties.description: Nestled amidst the tall timber of Bramley National Park, in walking distance to Margaret River, Wharncliffe Mill Bush Retreat is surrounded by world class mountain bike and walk trails. This small family run bush camp offers the chance to stay in a comfortable cabin, eco-lodge, safari tent, dormitory bed, caravan park.

properties.name: Waychinicup Campground
properties.description:
Located in the Waychinicup National Park, visitors to this campground will enjoy picturesque views of the Inlet, with polished granite rocks on each side. 

Swimming, bushwalking, rock climbing, nature photography and observation are all popular activities in this Park.

properties.name: Wavecrest Village Tourist Park
properties.description: Modern tourist park located at Wavecrest Village in Hopetoun on the spectacular southern coast of Western Australia (between Albany and Esperance), in the Australia's Golden Outback region.

properties.name: Victoria Rock Campground
properties.description: Victoria Rock campground has two walk-in campsites, eight vehicle-based campsites (one of which is suitable for caravans) and one group campsite. Wood barbecues, picnic tables, toilets and an information shelter are provided. You need to bring your own drinking water and firewood.

properties.name: Skippy Rock Campground
properties.description:
Located within Stokes National Park, Skippy Rock offers great fishing and diving experiences. The Campground has nine sites suitable for tents and regular size campervans, camper trailers and caravans. 
Barbecues, picnic tables and toilets are provided; however, campers are encouraged to be self-reliant

properties.name: Point Road Campground
properties.description: A small, sheltered campground set in peppermint woodland on the fringes of the majestic Boranup Forest.

properties.name: Perth Hills Centre Campground
properties.description: Perth Hills Discovery Centre is a small, well-appointed campground that is ideal for first-time campers and families with small children. All 12 camp sites are suitable for small tents (up to 3m x 2.5m floor area) only. Larger tents, campervans, camper trailers and caravans cannot be accommodated. Dogs are not permitted in Beelu National Park.

properties.name: Peak Charles Campground
properties.description:
Located in Peak Charles National Park, visitors to this campground can enjoy bushwalking and birdwatching in the biologically rich Great Western Woodlands of the area. 

Experienced rock climbers will enjoy abseiling on the eastern side of the Peak, which offers high quality, steep climbs of up to 300 metres.

properties.name: Nanga Townsite Camp
properties.description: Nanga Townsite Camp is one of a number of campgrounds situated along the Murray River within Lane Poole Reserve, which covers some 55,000 hectares of Jarrah Forest just 100 kilometres from Perth near Dwellingup. Campers can enjoy numerous recreational activities from bushwalking and cycling to swimming, canoeing and more.

properties.name: Mt Trio Bush Camp and Caravan Park
properties.description: Mt Trio Bush Camp and Caravan Park, Stirling Ranges is situated in a peaceful natural bush enclave on a working farm bordering the Stirling Range National Park.

properties.name: Ivanhoe Village Caravan Resort
properties.description: Perfectly situated to explore the spectacular and diverse East Kimberley region, including the Gibb River Road and Lake Argyle.

properties.name: Honeymoon Pool Camp
properties.description: Located in Wellington National Park, Honeymoon Pool has access to the Collie River, making it a great spot for enjoying swimming, canoeing and kayaking. There are also a number of walk and cycle trails in the National Park, including the Munda Middi off-road cycle trail. The campground has 20 campsites.

properties.name: Geographe Bay Holiday Park
properties.description: Geographe Bay Holiday Park is a modern family orientated accommodation park

properties.name: Fanny Cove Camp
properties.description: Located within Stokes National Park, Fanny Cove is a great fishing spot. The Campground is close to the beach with facilities suited to tents, regular size campervans, camper trailers and caravans, and large size camper vans and rooftop tents.

properties.name: Draftys Campground
properties.description: Drafty's Camp is located within the old-growth karri forest of Warren National Park. With access to the Warren River via purpose-built steps, campers can enjoy fishing, canoeing, kayaking and white-water rafting.
properties.fees: $11.50 per adult plus $13.00 park entry fee

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Bunbury Village
properties.description: World-class wine, pristine beaches and magnificent forests in a single day? It’s all possible when you stay with us at Discovery Parks – Bunbury Village, just over two hours from Perth and 30 minutes from Busselton.

properties.name: Conto Field Campground
properties.description:
Located in the Leeuwin-Naturaliste National Park, Conto Field Camp has access to the coast via a sandy track suitable for 2WD vehicles. The beach and rocky shores, however, can only be accessed by foot. 
Fishing is not permitted.

properties.name: Congelin Campground
properties.description:
Located within the Dryandra Woodland conservation area, Congelin Campground is the ideal destination for campers with an interest in nature observation and photography. 

You can find Western Australia's state mammal emblem, the numbat, as well as wallabies, possums, small marsupials like woylies and phascogales.

properties.name: Chuditch Campground
properties.description: Lane Poole Reserve covers some 55,000 hectares of Jarrah forest just 100 kilometres from Perth near Dwellingup. The Murray River flows through the reserve and offers numerous recreational activities from swimming and canoeing to white-water rafting.

properties.name: Charlies Flat Campground
properties.description:
Lane Poole Reserve covers some 55,000 hectares of Jarrah forest just 100 kilometres from Perth near Dwellingup. The Murray River flows through the reserve and offers numerous recreational activities from swimming and canoeing to white-water rafting.

Charlie's Flat is one of a number of small campgrounds situated al...

properties.name: Boondi Rock Camp at Goldfields Woodlands National Park
properties.description:
Boondi Rock Camp is located in the Goldfields Woodlands National Park, which has attractive spring wildflower displays, and is traversed by the four-wheel-drive Holland Track. It's also a stop on the Golden Pipeline Heritage Trail.

With its large granite outcrops, eucalypt woodlands, sand plains, salt lake and freshwater swamps, the Park is unique in its offerings for birdwatching, bushwalking, photography and nature enthusiasts alike.

The campground has seven vehicle-based sites which cater for camper trailers and/or caravans.

Wood barbecues, picnic tables and toilets are provided.

Campfires are permitted in certain seasons. Bring your own firewood.

Campers are advised to bring enough drinking water for the duration of their stay.

Bookings cannot be made.

Camping fees do not apply at this campground; however, park entry fees apply at Goldfields Woodlands National Park.

properties.name: Boat Harbour Campground
properties.description:
Boat Harbour is a small campground adjacent to a recreation zone of Ningaloo Marine Park.

Booking:
Bookings are essential and can be made up to 180 days (approximately six months) before arrival and for one campsite only. The maximum stay in any park is 14 nights if any night is during Western Australia public school holidays, 28 nights at any other time.

If you are an outdoor education provider, licensed commercial tour operator or are organising an event (friends, family and other social groups camping together does not constitute an event), contact Parks and Wildlife Service Milyering Discovery Centre (Cape Range National Park) to discuss your requirements.

Campsites:
Five reverse-in sand surface campsites.

All campsites are unpowered.

Check campsite details and the campground map carefully when booking.

Facilities:
No-flush pit toilet.

Campground Rules:
- No campfires at any time.
- Dogs are not permitted.
- Generator use is permitted at all campsites between 8am-9pm only.
- Do not empty your portable toilet waste into campground toilets. Carry waste out of the park for disposal in an authorised dump point.
- Dispose of non-toilet waste in the bins provided at the campground or carry out of the park.

Fees:
A per person camping fee and a per vehicle park entry fee apply.

Camping fee must be paid by Mastercard or VISA when booking.

Vehicle entry fee may be paid when booking, on arrival at Cape Range National Park or by purchasing a park pass and is required for motor vehicles only. Payment is not required for trailers, including camper trailers and caravans.

properties.name: Valley Campground
properties.description: Valley Camp is located in the stunning Avon Valley National Park. Close to jarrah, marri and powderbark forest, the valleys themselves are forested with wandoo, making for peaceful bushwalks through the area.

properties.name: Baden Powell Campground
properties.description: Lane Poole Reserve covers some 55,000 hectares of Jarrah forest just 100 kilometres from Perth near Dwellingup. The Murray River flows through the reserve and offers numerous recreational activities from swimming and canoeing to white-water rafting.

properties.name: Ayr Sailean
properties.description: Midway between Denmark & Walpole, and just 55 minutes from Albany

properties.name: Albany Holiday Park
properties.description: Albany Holiday Park was designed around the needs of travellers

properties.name: Quaalup Homestead Wilderness Retreat
properties.description: Quaalup Homestead Wilderness Retreat is 40 acres of native bush surrounded by the Fitzgerald River National Park, a UNESCO recognised Biosphere Reserve with extremely diverse flora and fauna, rugged mountain ranges, beaches, gorges and inlets. You can enjoy nature walks with stunning views, the Nature Information Ce...

properties.name: Goulet Bluff
properties.description: Goulet Bluff is and easily accessed self-contained vehicle site located close to Shell Beach. No facilities are available on-site, and all rubbish/waste is to be removed from the site. Permission to stay here must be obtained through the shire office by telephone or in person; $1000 fine for those who camp here without first obtaining permission.

properties.name: Wongan Hills Caravan Park
properties.description: Wongan Hills Caravan Park is located opposite the Christmas Rock Trail. There is a range of accomodation available including powered and unpowered sites and onsite accomodation. Facilities include 2 ablution blocks, BBQ area, and coin operated laundromat. There is a dump point located at Wongan Hills Tourism Centre. Bookings can be made by phone or email.
properties.fees: AUD $ 22 per person/powered site $25/ 2ppl. AUD $15 per person/ $20 per 2 ppl/ unpowered site.

properties.name: Wickepin Caravan Park
properties.description:
The Wickepin Caravan Park is located on Wogolin Road and offers 12 powered sites for caravans, tents or camper vans. 

Two single and one double accommodation units are also available for rent. Clean ablution facilities, including laundry and BBQ area are available.

properties.name: Kellerberrin Caravan Park
properties.description: Kellerberrin Caravan Park provides powered and unpowered sites for camping, caravans and large RVs. There are also cabin rooms available for hire. Facilities include laundry area, BBQ, ablution block, chilrdren's playground and dump station. There is an onsite manager.

properties.name: Lake Brockman Tourist Park
properties.description: Lake Brockman Tourist Park
properties.fees: From $15 Per Adult and $3 Per Child  Per Night (Non Powered Campsites)

properties.name: Walpole Rest Point Caravan Park
properties.description: Rest Point Caravan Park is a beautiful holiday park in Walpole that has many great shared amenities for visitors.

properties.name: Cosy Corner East
properties.description:
This is a beautiful, clean and quiet overnight area located by the shore. There is lots of shade and good amenities. 

To access, please search for a sign marking an unsealed road on the left. 

Maximum stay of 7 days applies.

properties.name: Wubin Rocks Camp Area
properties.description: This is a camping spot 8 km NE of Wubin or 149 km SW of Payne's Find. It is a small grass and dirt area with a narrow and winding dirt track not suitable for long vehicles. There is a rubbish bin and fire ring but no other facilities. It has a nice view over the surrounding farmland. There is some shady trees and open areas. Small vehicles can access this area.

properties.name: Wrights Bridge Paid Camping
properties.description: This is a paid camping area. It is a small dirt surfaced area with picnic tables and rubbish bins, fire pits and an eco toilet. It is remote and secluded. It is not too far from the road, but the road is a lightly traveled one so it is quiet. All types of vehicles can access this area, but larger vehicles may have problems turning around.

properties.name: House Creek Bridge Stop
properties.description: This is a rest area 62 km E of Nanutarra Roadhouse or 162 km W of Paraburdoo/Wittenoom Rd junction. It is a standard Main Roads Western Australia 24 Hour stopping area. It is a bush camping site in the dirt with dense bush areas. There is an ecotoilet, rubbish bins, fire pits, and a dump station. It is not on a main thoroughfare so it is quieter This area is a bit lower than the highway and can be muddy in wet weather, however all vehicles can access this area.  Maximum stay: 24 Hours

properties.name: Kambalda West
properties.description: This is a parking area in Kambalda for self-contained vehicles. It is a large dirt surfaced carpark on the edge of town. There are no facilities here except for a dump station. It is quiet and secluded but in town so during the day it may be busier. No Dumping of Liquids to ground. No generators. No camping (only self-contained vehicles). Maximum stay: 24 Hours

properties.name: Masons Bay Campground
properties.description: Newly reconstructed.

properties.name: Turf Club Campground
properties.description: Basic camping spot, no facilities. All vehicles using this rest area must be self contained.

properties.name: Ningaloo Homestead
properties.description:
Wilderness campers must be fully self sufficient and carry / transport everything into their designated camp site, enjoy the natural surroundings and leave nothing behind. 

No facilities are provided and camps are well spaced to ensure a sense of privacy and comfort for all.

On arrival at Ningaloo station you will need to register at the homestead to collect your access key and map to your designated campsite.

properties.name: North Mandu Campground
properties.description: Located in Cape Range National Park, North Mandu Camp has access to a wide sandy beach for swimming, snorkelling and launching canoes and kayaks in the Ningaloo Marine Park.

properties.name: Herald Bight Campground
properties.description: Francois Peron National Park is an ideal destination for bush camping, four-wheel driving, bush walking and beach fishing, along with swimming and boating within the Shark Bay Marine Park. Originally a pearling camp in the late 1880's, Herald Bight is now an informal campsite with toilets provided as basic facilities.

properties.name: Galena Bridge Rest Area North
properties.description: This large, overnight rest area with good amenities, is located off the highway, on the bank of the Murchison River. Suitable for big rigs. Maximum stay is 24hrs.

properties.name: Normans Beach Camping
properties.description: This is a camping area 14 km S of Many Peaks. Turn SE off South Coast Hwy 3 km SW of Many Peaks or 36 km NE of Albany onto Homestead Rd for 9 km, then onto Normans Beach Rd for 2 km. 6 km dirt road that is corrugated in parts, but suitable for all vehicles. In very wet weather it could be a challenge with 2WD. This area is not large and is suitable for 5-8 vehicles. There are mangrove trees in the water. There is a toilet and picnic area and a rubbish bin.

properties.name: Brockman River Pullover Area
properties.description: This is a medium sized dirt pullover at the junction of two country roads. It is a level open area next to the Brockman River. There are two picnic tables and rubbish bins here. There is also an informational sign about the area. The surface is dirt and all types of vehicles can access this area. Although it is next to and visible from the road, it is a quiet site at night as these roads are lightly traveled. There is some shade but little seclusion.

properties.name: Rockingham Holiday Village
properties.description:
Set in 20 acres of tranquil native bushland on the outskirts of Rockingham, 47 kilometers from Perth, Rockingham Holiday Village is only minutes away from some of Western Australia’s pristine golden beaches, native wildlife and the vibrant Rockingham City Centre and Foreshore. 

Awake to the sound of native birds and enjoy the best onsite facilities and local attractions Rockingham has to offer.

Rockingham Holiday Village offers a range of accommodation to suit your holiday needs, with spacious powered Caravan sites located close to Village amenities to self-contained cabins set deep amongst native flora and fauna.

properties.name: Fly Esperance Scenic Flights & Tours
properties.description:
Take a Scenic Flight with Esperance’s only Local Scenic Flight Company to see the uniquely Pink Lakes of the region, including the spectacular Pink and Rainbow Lakes, beautiful coastline and snow-white beaches of Cape Le Grand, Lucky Bay and beyond.

Fly Esperance operate several departures daily and fly year-round.  

We have a range of Scenic Flight options and can cater for group sizes ranging from individuals to large family or tour groups.

properties.name: Mitchell Falls Campground
properties.description:
Some campsites have their own fire ring. Firewood must be collected before entering the park. Firewood collecting areas are signposted along Port Warrender Road. Preferably use your own portable gas or fuel stove.

There is a swimming area downstream of the start of the walk trail. Soaps and detergents are not permitted in the creeks and rivers. It is recommended that water is boiled or otherwise treated before drinking.

properties.name: Toodyay Holiday Park & Chalets
properties.description:
Escape to Toodyay Holiday Park & Chalets set in 25 acres of natural bushland.

This is bush camping at its best, where at different times of the year the wildlife and wildflowers are in abundance.

At Toodyay Holiday Park & Chalets we have spacious camping areas and drive through powered sites. Valet parking is available if required. Mostly open plan drive through sites.  All sites easily accessible and shady. 

Modern facilities and campers kitchen with vending machine plus on site Kiosk.

Sit around an open camp fire in season with the  bush as a divine back drop.

Toodyay has lots to experience from walking along the Avon River to its award winning bakery, cafes/restaurants and Taverns. Toodyay is a historic town with many historic buildings including the Old Gaol Museum and Connors Mill. 

Local attractions include wineries, craft and gift shops, organic honey, miniature railway, Fairytale Farm, emu & alpaca farms and the Toodyay golf course.

Yearly festivals include: Avon Descent and International Food Festival, Moondyne Festival, Toodyay Agricultural Show, Toodyay Picnic Races, Targa West Rally, the stunning wildflower season and the Toodyay Farmers Market, held every month.

properties.name: Djarindjin Campground
properties.description:
Welcome to Djarindjin Campground. 

Our modern amenities, powered caravan/campsites and highly accessible location on the newly sealed Cape Leveque Road, make this a welcoming stopover on your Kimberley journey, or a great base from which to explore the best of the Dampier Peninsula.

properties.name: Balingup Visitor Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Pinjarrah Holiday Park
properties.description:
Blissful Sunsets, open spaces share with good friends and family
  
Open Camping and caravaning allows vehicle combinations of all sizes to park individually  or as a group. Camp fires are allowed in season provided usage of an enclosed fire container, wood should be bought with you or purchased locally.

​You enter Pinjarrah Holiday Park 3.26klms from the Premier Hotel on the road to Dwellingup at the gate the sign says 400 m to Reception the reception sign is at the tank stand where the yellow cones are our office is at the new house just a short walk up the path say hello to Peter the pink and grey galah on the way.

properties.name: Menzies Caravan Park
properties.description: Powered sites, cabins and tent sites. Bookings are run via the information centre which is open until 4.30, but after hours self-service is available with an honesty box in the camp kitchen.

properties.name: Tarangau Caravan Park
properties.description:
Tarangau Caravan Park – The Quiet Alternative. Set behind the dunes of Cable Beach amongst shady trees, local flora and fauna. Within walking distance to restaurants and cafes as well as Cable Beach itself, which boasts 22 kilometres of sun-kissed white sand and turquoise water.
Tarangau Caravan Park is a quiet park where you can relax and enjoy your tropical holiday. Go swimming or ride a camel along the beach, do some fishing or watch the magnificent Cable Beach sunsets.

Our location is perfect for travellers wishing to visit Broome and Cable Beach but also for the more adventurous wishing to explore both Cape Leveque and further into the Kimberley region. 

Our friendly Reception staff provide a fully operational tour booking/information office with a great variety of both day and overnight tours available to suit all budgets and tastes. With tour companies collecting you from the front of the Caravan Park and returning at the end of the day, it is a hassle free way to make the most of Broome, Cable Beach, Cape Leveque and the vast Kimberley region.

We look forward to welcoming you to our wonderful caravan park at Cable Beach, Broome and making your holiday experience a memorable one!

properties.name: Albany Visitor Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Waroona Caravan Village
properties.description:
Welcome to the Waroona Caravan and Camping Village.

The Waroona Caravan Village is quietly nestled amongst tall trees just outside the town center, where each site is provided with its own private bathroom facilities.

properties.name: Lewana Campsites
properties.description: Levana is a historic ex-forestry workers' estate located on the Blackwood River and Tourist Route 251 between Balingup and Nannup. The 100-acre property is situated amongst state and pine forests, and the parkland setting has over 50 different tree varieties creating a beautiful place to stay at any time of year. Levana is the ideal place to base yourself to enjoy the picturesque region of Balingup and the surrounding areas, including Donnybrook, Nannup and Bridgetown.

properties.name: Busselton Villas & Caravan Park
properties.description: Escape  with the perfect  getaway to the beautiful region of Western Australia’s South West. Nestled amongst peppermint trees with breathtaking views of Geographe Bay, Busselton Villas & Caravan Park is a quiet oasis, just a stone’s throw from pristine beaches where you can enjoy swimming,  snorkeling  and fishing, or just laze about in the sun and sand

properties.name: Manjimup Central Caravan Park
properties.description: Very clean and spacious park. Central to everything. Friendly staff. Large bays for caravan and car.

properties.name: Katanning Caravan Park
properties.description:
The Katanning Caravan Park is situated in the heart of the Great Southern. All efforts are being made to ensure your stay is a pleasant one!

We have 25 powered sites, several are suitable for drive-through, or large 5th wheel rigs.

properties.name: Crystal Brook Caravan Park
properties.description: Crystal Brook is set on 10 acres with an 17km drive to The Perth CBD.

properties.name: Melangata Station Stay
properties.description:
Melangata Station Stay is situated in the Yalgoo Shire of Western Australia between the Murchison and Midwest.

We offer catered, dinner bed and breakfast accommodation in the homestead, beautiful bell tents, shearers quarters and camp sites.

The station has a unique Homestead that was designed in 1916 by the Architect/Priest Monsignor John Hawes. It is the only privately owned residence that he designed that was ever built in Australia and it is also his first commission in the area before any of his churches were built.

 Open from April till October. 

(Strictly NO visiting dogs)

properties.name: Jerramungup Caravan Park
properties.description: Jerramungup Caravan Park is conveniently located for travel to Fitzgerald River National Park, Bremer Bay, Esperance, Albany and all places of interest in The Great Southern Region of WA. We have powered and unpowered caravan and campsites, single rooms and self-contained cabins, laundry, clean toilet and shower facilities and well-appointed camp kitchen. Well-behaved pets are welcome to stay in caravan sites and campsites.
properties.fees: Un-powered sites $26.00/night for 2 persons .Powered sites $30.00/night for 2 persons.

properties.name: Alice Atkinson Sandstone Caravan Park
properties.description: The Alice Atkinson Caravan Park in Sandstone is a 40 site park set in pleasant surroundings centrally located in the town. The park features first class ablution facilities that also cater for the disabled, along with washing machines, dryers, BBQ area, picnic tables and friendly service. There is a well equipped camp kitchen, TV room and playground. Dogs on a leash are welcome. No bookings required, the caravan park is operated on a first in basis.

properties.name: Twin Waters Caravan Park
properties.description: Twin Waters Caravan Park

properties.name: Northcliffe Visitor Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Back to Nature Caravan Park
properties.description: Back to Nature Caravan Park is a quiet secluded park which was opened in July 2011. The Park is located in West Gingin, and is just an hours drive north of the metro area.

properties.name: Peedamulla Campground
properties.description: Welcome to Peedamulla, meaning ‘plenty water’ in local Aboriginal language, where the Cane River runs through 226,000 hectares of cattle station. Peedamulla’s newly built campground has modern amenities, powered & unpowered sites, wonderful views of the expansive countryside, with opportunity to explore isolated coastline, wetlands and heritage listed ruins, along with the warm hospitality of local Aboriginal owners, the Parker family.
properties.fees: Unpowered Site $30.00 (2 people)Powered Site $40 (2 people)Children under 15yrs  – 2 free per siteAdditional People $10.00 each.  Infants free.

properties.name: The Cove Holiday Village
properties.description: From our cabins to our tent sites, everyone is comfortable at The Cove

properties.name: Kondinin Caravan Park
properties.description: The Kondinin Caravan Park is peacefully located on the edge of town in beautiful natural surrounds, close to all amenities including powered and unpowered sites. Facilities include an Ablution block, Campers kitchen. A kitchen is located in the centre between the camp sites and chalets. A BBQ is available in the Caravan Park, adjacent to the centenary mosaic walk. The bus stop for the route to Perth and Esperance is on the doorstep of the caravan park, which also neighbours the sport and recreation centre. A newly designed nature walk is only one kilometre away, providing the perfect place to see and find a wide variety of flora and fauna.
properties.fees: Unpowered Site from $15 per nightPowered Site from $25 per nightSelf Contained Chalet$80.00-$160.00

properties.name: Gascoyne Junction Pub & Tourist Park
properties.description:
Nestled on the banks of the mighty Gascoyne River, the Junction Pub & Tourist Park established in 2014 offers guests a destination that boasts modern furnishings and a variety of accommodation styles to suit any traveller.  

Situated in Gascoyne Junction, the 2023 National Tidy Town winner, the Junction Pub & Tourist Park offers beuatiful sunset views across the nearby Kennedy Range National Park and green lawn, playgrounds and a pool to unwind after a day of travel and exploring.

Our caravan and camping sites offer visitors a variety of options from ensuite sites to grass non powered sites.  Many of our van sites have views to Kennedy Range where you can watch the sunset after a day of travel.

Gascoyne Junction itself is the gateway to the ancient landscapes of Kennedy Range National Park (60km north) and the world's largest rock Mount Augustus (appx 300km north east). The town is ove 100 years old and sits where the Gascoyne and Lyons Rivers meet.

Enjoy a meal prepared by our renowned Chef Omo at the tavern restaurant or enjoy a cold drink with friends old and new in our outdoor dining area. The roadhouse offers takeaway options, barista coffee and a range of supermarket items.

Refuel 24/7 with unleaded and diesel at the roadhouse.

properties.name: Town Caravan Park
properties.description: Just a short walk from the Town's centre, Town Caravan Park

properties.name: Collie River Valley Tourist Park
properties.description: An awesome base in Collie to explore the many attractions of the Geographe area, or just chill out, with a variety of accommodation choices.

properties.name: White Gum Farm
properties.description:
Set in amongst the native 'white gum' trees, this is a great bush retreat ideal to bring the family for a quiet stay. White Gum Farm offers various styles of accommodation at affordable rates for all its students.
Ranging from caravan parking to self contained bungalow with air-conditioning.

properties.name: Fonty's Pool Caravan Park
properties.description: An ideal base for exploring WA's beautiful South West. Enjoy the taste of the famous black truffle, visit award winning wineries, marvel at the tall timber forests and fresh produce grown on Seven Day Road. Enjoyfour-starr chalets and cabin accommodation, shady powered caravan and camp sites. We have a fabulous new campers kitchen and clean ammenities convenient to all sites. With plenty of room to spead out, there is something for everyone at Fontys Pool.
properties.fees: Powered Sites$35 per night per double OFF PEAK$52 per night per double SHOULDER season$82 per night in PEAK set for up to 4 people$ 5 each extra child (3yrs - 15yrs)$ 10 each extra adult (16yrs and older)Unpowered Sites$30 per night per double OFF PEAK$40 per night per double PEAK

properties.name: Mount Augustus Tourist Park
properties.description: A friendly caravan park with unit accommodation and camping grounds, with hot showers, laundry and a BBQ campers' kitchen for self catering.  Pets are welcome though they must be kept under control so all can have a good holiday.

properties.name: Flinders Bay Caravan Park
properties.description: Nestled on the shores of the magnificent and pristine waters of Flinders Bay. Beachfront caravan park and dog friendly too! Shady and grassed campsites.

properties.name: Goomalling Caravan Park
properties.description: Goomalling Caravan Park is a picturesque place for motor homers, caravanners and other travellers to stop and relax. Located next to the War Memorial Swimming Pool on Throssell Street (the Northam-Pithara Rd).

properties.name: Dunsborough Lakes Holiday Resort and Caravan Park
properties.description: Dunsborough Lakes Holiday Resort and Caravan Park is optimal located with 5-minute walk to beach.

properties.name: Broome Visitor Centre
properties.description: Australia's Nationally Accredited Information Centres are staffed by local experts and are your one-stop-shop for maps of the region and information about the best things to see, as well as booking tours and accommodation.

properties.name: Point Samson Caravan Park
properties.description: Small van park on the beach , with a few tent sites. Free BBQ and WiFi . Next door to bar and restaurant.

properties.name: Lake Navarino Holiday Park
properties.description: The park's accommodation is set amongst the natural lakeside forest

properties.name: Ellenbrae Station
properties.description: Fresh scones baked daily and two waterholes for overnight guests

properties.name: Hutt Lagoon Pink Lake
properties.description:
Hutt Lagoon is a pink lake which boasts a pink hue created by presence of carotenoid-producing algae Dunaliella salina, a source of carotene, a food-colouring agent and source of vitamin A.

Depending on the time of day, the season (time of year) and the amount of cloud cover, the lake changes through the spectrum of red to bubble-gum pink to a lilac purple. 

The best time of day to visit is mid-morning or sundown.

Hutt Lagoon can be easily accessed by road along the George Grey Drive, between Geraldton and Kalbarri.

properties.name: Mukinbudin Caravan Park
properties.description:
Mukinbudin Caravan Park is well catered for tourists offering 29 shady powered sites and 9 unpowered sites, 4 twin-share cabins with reverse cycle air-conditioning, 3 modern self contained park units with air conditioning, a self-contained house, new ablutions with disabled access and camper's Kitchen. 

WiFi Available.

Centrally located in the friendly town of Mukinbudin, approximately three hours from Perth and featured as part of the Wheatbelt Way Self-Drive.

properties.name: Shark Bay World Heritage Drive
properties.description:
The easy, 160 kilometres drive Top Trail, from Overlander to Monkey Mia, takes in all the significant features that give Shark Bay its World Heritage Listing. 

800 kilometres from Perth, Western Australia, Shark Bay is the most western point of the coast of Australia and is made up of two peninsulas jutting out into the Indian Ocean.

properties.name: Dirk Hartog Island
properties.description:
Stay on Dirk Hartog Island, a magical escape off the coast of Western Australia, where you can experience the perfect getaway.

Located in the Shark Bay world heritage region on Australia’s Coral Coast, Dirk Hartog Island has a wide range of accommodation options including homestead camping that offers warm showers, barista-made coffees to start your day and sundowner cocktails at The Inscription, the world’s most remote bar and cafe.

properties.name: Cape to Cape Track
properties.description:
The Cape to Cape Walk Track runs for 135 kilometres along the Leeuwin-Naturaliste Ridge, between the lighthouse of Cape Naturaliste and Cape Leeuwin in the far south west of Western Australia. 

The moderate Top Trail features spectacular coastal and forest scenery, a fascinating geology of cliffs, caves, headlands and surrounding area.

properties.name: Nannup Caravan Park
properties.description: Nannup Caravan Park is an old-fashioned, pet-friendly caravan and camping ground on the banks of the Blackwood River in the heart of the south west of Western Australia. The perfect base for exploring forests, coastlines and the people of the region. Nannup Caravan Park can cater to all your caravan and camping site needs. With over 95 sites, both powered and unpowered, we can accommodate everything from a single person swag right up to a huge fifth wheeler.

properties.name: Lake Grace Caravan Park
properties.description: Grassy area with lots of shade, 10 powered and 10 unpowered sites.
properties.fees: Unpowered is $17 for 2, $28 for powered sites

properties.name: Fitzroy River Lodge
properties.description: Fitzroy River Lodge is located in the heart of the Kimberley. Situated on the banks of the mighty Fitzroy River, Fitzroy River Lodge offers a wide range of accommodation to suit all travellers. At the Fitzroy River Lodge you can relax on fifty acres of natural bush with shady trees and landscaped gardens.

properties.name: Karalundi Caravan Park
properties.description: Project with a meaning - many high school students gain their experience here! Nice and spacious sites and ok food in the cafe. Great atmosphere!

properties.name: Riverbend Chalets & Caravan Park
properties.description:
We are located in a peaceful rural setting on the Denmark river and just 2km from Denmark townsite. You will find us just off the Scotsdale tourist trail.

We offer a small family run park with clean amenities, spacious concrete/grass sites (powered and unpowered), 6 traditional chalets, an on-site van, bbqs and laundry.

properties.name: Thirty Seven Mile Camp
properties.description: Thirty Seven Mile Camp is located in the stunning Avon Valley National Park. Close to jarrah, marri and powderbark forest, the valleys themselves are forested with wandoo, making for peaceful bushwalks through the area.

properties.name: Snottygobble Loop Campground
properties.description:
Snottygobble Loop offers visitor vehicle-based camping opportunities tucked away under the peppermint trees. The 11 campsites share sheltered facilities, and there is a large site that is suitable for groups or families. Camp fees apply.

Campfires are usually permitted, in the provided fire rings only, between April 15 and November 30 but fire restrictions may be imposed at any time and without notice. Bring your own firewood. When fire restrictions are in place campfires must not be lit and any appliance powered by burning solid fuel must not be used. Always comply with any instructions at campgrounds and parks.

Campers´ own liquid or gas fuel barbeques, stoves and heaters can be used at any time, unless a total fire ban has been declared.

Bushwalkers and birdwatchers can see what they can spot from various trails through the scrub, and anglers will find the brook a good spot for freshwater fishing.

Goblin Swamp was damaged in a bushfire and is closed for repairs. The walk trail between Snotty Gobble Loop Campground and Goblin Swamp is also closed. You can still follow the 1km trail between Grass Tree Hollow and Snotty Gobble Loop campgrounds. 

A walk trail that begins at Grass Tree Hollow campsite passes through Snottygobble Loop and takes the visitor through the forest to Goblin Swamp.

- Distance: 2.5km one way*
- Class: 3 moderately easy
- Time: Allow 1½ hours

*This is the distance of the whole walk trail, not just from Snottygobble Loop to Goblin Swamp.

properties.name: Notch Point Camp
properties.description: Notch Point Camp is located in Dirk Hartog Island National Park, making it the perfect destination for a snorkelling and diving holiday.

properties.name: Louisa Bay Camp
properties.description: Louisa Bay Camp is located in Dirk Hartog Island National Park, making it the perfect destination for a snorkelling and diving holiday. Visitors can enjoy the beautiful coral of the Shark Bay Marine Park, as well as a number of reef fish including coral trout, blue-lined emperor and scribbled angelfish.

properties.name: Honeymoon Pool - Stones Brook Camp
properties.description: Located in Wellington National Park, Honeymoon Pool-Stones Brook has access to its namesake brook near its confluence with the Collie River, making it a great spot for enjoying swimming, canoeing and kayaking.

properties.name: Honeymoon Pool - Gelcoat Camp
properties.description: Located in Wellington National Park, Honeymoon Pool-Gelcoat has access to the Collie River, making it a great spot for enjoying swimming, canoeing and kayaking.

properties.name: Grass Tree Hollow Campground
properties.description: Located in the Cleave State Forest, Grass Tree Hollow Camp is a great spot for enjoying freshwater fishing in the crystal clear waters of Carey Brook, or bird watching in the area's lush forest. There is also a walking trail extending from the campsite, through the forest, to nearby Goblin Swamp.

properties.name: Barrabup Camp
properties.description: Located in St Johns Brook Conservation Park, Barrabup Camp is situated close to picturesque river pools, making it a favourite for swimming and picnicking.

properties.name: Bald Hill Campground
properties.description: Bald Hill Camp is located in the stunning Avon Valley National Park. Close to jarrah, marri and powderbark forest, the valleys themselves are forested with wandoo, making for peaceful bushwalks through the area.

properties.name: Wolfe Creek Crater Campground
properties.description:
For a camping holiday with a difference, you can visit the spectacular Wolfe Creek Crater, the second largest meteorite crater in the world. 

The campground has an information shelter and toilets, and is accessible only by four wheel drive (4WD).

Campers are advised to bring enough drinking water for the durat...

properties.name: Warren Campground
properties.description: Warren Camp is located within the old growth karri forest of Warren National Park. With access to the Warren River via purpose built steps, campers can enjoy fishing, canoeing, kayaking and whitewater rafting.

properties.name: Walardi Campground
properties.description: Walardi campground is within the Purnululu National Park World Heritage Area (also known as the Bungle Bungles), and close to Cathedral Gorge. This campground can only be accessed by four-wheel-drive vehicles. High clearance, single axle, towable units are only permitted due to the road conditions.

properties.name: WA Wilderness Catered Camping at Draftys Campsite
properties.description: WA Wilderness is a catered camping service available in selected locations in WA's South West, that aims to give the opportunity of camping to everyone, even those who are unable to buy or store the equipment.

properties.name: WA Wilderness Catered Camping at Big Brook Arboretum
properties.description:
WA Wilderness is a catered camping service available in selected locations in WA's South West, that aims to give the opportunity of camping to everyone, even those who are unable to buy or store the equipment.



All you have to do is pick your location and book ahead, then simply turn up to your campsite .

properties.name: Tonys Bend Campground
properties.description:
Lane Poole Reserve covers some 55,000 hectares of Jarrah forest just 100 kilometres from Perth near Dwellingup. The Murray River flows through the reserve and offers numerous recreational activities from swimming and canoeing to white-water rafting.

Tony's Bend is one of a number of small campgrounds situated along the Murray River.

properties.name: Discovery Parks - Margaret River
properties.description: Discovery Parks - Margaret River is a rural Holiday Park right in the heart of the Margaret River wine, food, nature and surf region of Western Australia. Base yourself in the park to explore nearby caves, wineries, surf beaches, whale watching cruises and much more around Margaret River and Cowaramup.

properties.name: Stringers Campground
properties.description:
Lane Poole Reserve covers some 55,000 hectares of Jarrah forest just 100 kilometres from Perth near Dwellingup. The Murray River flows through the reserve and offers numerous recreational activities from swimming and canoeing to white-water rafting.

Stringer's is one of a number of small campgrounds situated along the Murray River.

properties.name: Stirling Range Retreat
properties.description: Stirling Range Retreat is an award-winning, accredited ecotourism destination opposite Bluff Knoll Road - with choices of budget and air-conditioned, fully self-contained chalets plus caravan/camping sites with sunrise, sunset and mountain views.

properties.name: Stargazers Campground
properties.description:
Located in the Millstream-Chichester National Park, Stargazers Camp is close to Deep Reach Pool on the Fortescue River (2.5 kilometres away), where campers can enjoy swimming, canoeing and kayaking. 

Bushwalking trails are also close by (approximately 3 kilometres away), near the Millstream Homestead Visitor Centre with options for all ages and fitness levels. For keen walkers, there are also a number of other walk trails further from the camp in the Chichester Ranges.

properties.name: St Mary Inlet Campground
properties.description:
Fitzgerald River National Park is one of Australia's largest national parks and is home to nearly 20 per cent of Western Australia's flora species.
